71/*! \file
72 * Client Routines
73 *
74 * Important note!
75 *
76 * All client state changes, other than that from idle to listening, occur
77 * as a result of events. This guarantees serialization and avoids the
78 * need for locking.
79 *
80 * If a routine is ever created that allows someone other than the client's
81 * task to change the client, then the client will have to be locked.
82 */
83
84#define NS_CLIENT_TRACE
85#ifdef NS_CLIENT_TRACE
86#define CTRACE(m) ns_client_log(client, \
87 NS_LOGCATEGORY_CLIENT, \
88 NS_LOGMODULE_CLIENT, \
89 ISC_LOG_DEBUG(3), \
90 "%s", (m))
91#define MTRACE(m) isc_log_write(ns_lctx, \
92 NS_LOGCATEGORY_CLIENT, \
93 NS_LOGMODULE_CLIENT, \
94 ISC_LOG_DEBUG(3), \
95 "clientmgr @%p: %s", manager, (m))
96#else
97#define CTRACE(m) ((void)(m))
98#define MTRACE(m) ((void)(m))
99#endif
100
101#define TCP_CLIENT(c) (((c)->attributes & NS_CLIENTATTR_TCP) != 0)
102
103#define TCP_BUFFER_SIZE (65535 + 2)
104#define SEND_BUFFER_SIZE 4096
105#define RECV_BUFFER_SIZE 4096
106
107#define NMCTXS 100
108/*%<
109 * Number of 'mctx pools' for clients. (Should this be configurable?)
110 * When enabling threads, we use a pool of memory contexts shared by
111 * client objects, since concurrent access to a shared context would cause
112 * heavy contentions. The above constant is expected to be enough for
113 * completely avoiding contentions among threads for an authoritative-only
114 * server.
115 */
116
117#define COOKIE_SIZE 24U /* 8 + 4 + 4 + 8 */
118#define ECS_SIZE 20U /* 2 + 1 + 1 + [0..16] */
119
120#define WANTNSID(x) (((x)->attributes & NS_CLIENTATTR_WANTNSID) != 0)
121#define WANTEXPIRE(x) (((x)->attributes & NS_CLIENTATTR_WANTEXPIRE) != 0)
122#define WANTPAD(x) (((x)->attributes & NS_CLIENTATTR_WANTPAD) != 0)
123#define USEKEEPALIVE(x) (((x)->attributes & NS_CLIENTATTR_USEKEEPALIVE) != 0)
124
125/*% nameserver client manager structure */
126struct ns_clientmgr {
127 /* Unlocked. */
128 unsigned int magic;
129
130 /* The queue object has its own locks */
131 client_queue_t inactive; /*%< To be recycled */
132
133 isc_mem_t * mctx;
134 ns_server_t * sctx;
135 isc_taskmgr_t * taskmgr;
136 isc_timermgr_t * timermgr;
137 isc_task_t * excl;
138
139 /* Lock covers manager state. */
140 isc_mutex_t lock;
141 bool exiting;
142
143 /* Lock covers the clients list */
144 isc_mutex_t listlock;
145 client_list_t clients; /*%< All active clients */
146
147 /* Lock covers the recursing list */
148 isc_mutex_t reclock;
149 client_list_t recursing; /*%< Recursing clients */
150
151#if NMCTXS > 0
152 /*%< mctx pool for clients. */
153 unsigned int nextmctx;
154 isc_mem_t * mctxpool[NMCTXS];
155#endif
156};
157
158#define MANAGER_MAGIC ISC_MAGIC('N', 'S', 'C', 'm')
159#define VALID_MANAGER(m) ISC_MAGIC_VALID(m, MANAGER_MAGIC)
160
161/*!
162 * Client object states. Ordering is significant: higher-numbered
163 * states are generally "more active", meaning that the client can
164 * have more dynamically allocated data, outstanding events, etc.
165 * In the list below, any such properties listed for state N
166 * also apply to any state > N.
167 *
168 * To force the client into a less active state, set client->newstate
169 * to that state and call exit_check(). This will cause any
170 * activities defined for higher-numbered states to be aborted.
171 */
172
173#define NS_CLIENTSTATE_FREED 0
174/*%<
175 * The client object no longer exists.
176 */
177
178#define NS_CLIENTSTATE_INACTIVE 1
179/*%<
180 * The client object exists and has a task and timer.
181 * Its "query" struct and sendbuf are initialized.
182 * It is on the client manager's list of inactive clients.
183 * It has a message and OPT, both in the reset state.
184 */
185
186#define NS_CLIENTSTATE_READY 2
187/*%<
188 * The client object is either a TCP or a UDP one, and
189 * it is associated with a network interface. It is on the
190 * client manager's list of active clients.
191 *
192 * If it is a TCP client object, it has a TCP listener socket
193 * and an outstanding TCP listen request.
194 *
195 * If it is a UDP client object, it has a UDP listener socket
196 * and an outstanding UDP receive request.
197 */
198
199#define NS_CLIENTSTATE_READING 3
200/*%<
201 * The client object is a TCP client object that has received
202 * a connection. It has a tcpsocket, tcpmsg, TCP quota, and an
203 * outstanding TCP read request. This state is not used for
204 * UDP client objects.
205 */
206
207#define NS_CLIENTSTATE_WORKING 4
208/*%<
209 * The client object has received a request and is working
210 * on it. It has a view, and it may have any of a non-reset OPT,
211 * recursion quota, and an outstanding write request.
212 */
213
214#define NS_CLIENTSTATE_RECURSING 5
215/*%<
216 * The client object is recursing. It will be on the 'recursing'
217 * list.
218 */
219
220#define NS_CLIENTSTATE_MAX 9
221/*%<
222 * Sentinel value used to indicate "no state". When client->newstate
223 * has this value, we are not attempting to exit the current state.
224 * Must be greater than any valid state.
225 */
226
227/*
228 * Enable ns_client_dropport() by default.
229 */
230#ifndef NS_CLIENT_DROPPORT
231#define NS_CLIENT_DROPPORT 1
232#endif
233
234LIBNS_EXTERNAL_DATA unsigned int ns_client_requests;
235
236static void read_settimeout(ns_client_t *client, bool newconn);
237static void client_read(ns_client_t *client, bool newconn);
238static void client_accept(ns_client_t *client);
239static void client_udprecv(ns_client_t *client);
240static void clientmgr_destroy(ns_clientmgr_t *manager);
241static bool exit_check(ns_client_t *client);
242static void ns_client_endrequest(ns_client_t *client);
243static void client_start(isc_task_t *task, isc_event_t *event);
244static void ns_client_dumpmessage(ns_client_t *client, const char *reason);
245static isc_result_t get_client(ns_clientmgr_t *manager, ns_interface_t *ifp,
246 dns_dispatch_t *disp, bool tcp);
247static isc_result_t get_worker(ns_clientmgr_t *manager, ns_interface_t *ifp,
248 isc_socket_t *sock, ns_client_t *oldclient);
249static void compute_cookie(ns_client_t *client, uint32_t when,
250 uint32_t nonce, const unsigned char *secret,
251 isc_buffer_t *buf);
252
253void
254ns_client_recursing(ns_client_t *client) {
255 REQUIRE(NS_CLIENT_VALID(client));
256 REQUIRE(client->state == NS_CLIENTSTATE_WORKING);
257
258 LOCK(&client->manager->reclock);
259 client->newstate = client->state = NS_CLIENTSTATE_RECURSING;
260 ISC_LIST_APPEND(client->manager->recursing, client, rlink);
261 UNLOCK(&client->manager->reclock);
262}
263
264void
265ns_client_killoldestquery(ns_client_t *client) {
266 ns_client_t *oldest;
267 REQUIRE(NS_CLIENT_VALID(client));
268
269 LOCK(&client->manager->reclock);
270 oldest = ISC_LIST_HEAD(client->manager->recursing);
271 if (oldest != NULL) {
272 ISC_LIST_UNLINK(client->manager->recursing, oldest, rlink);
273 UNLOCK(&client->manager->reclock);
274 ns_query_cancel(oldest);
275 } else
276 UNLOCK(&client->manager->reclock);
277}
278
279void
280ns_client_settimeout(ns_client_t *client, unsigned int seconds) {
281 isc_result_t result;
282 isc_interval_t interval;
283
284 isc_interval_set(&interval, seconds, 0);
285 result = isc_timer_reset(client->timer, isc_timertype_once, NULL,
286 &interval, false);
287 client->timerset = true;
288 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS) {
289 ns_client_log(client, NS_LOGCATEGORY_CLIENT,
290 NS_LOGMODULE_CLIENT, ISC_LOG_ERROR,
291 "setting timeout: %s",
292 isc_result_totext(result));
293 /* Continue anyway. */
294 }
295}
296
297static void
298read_settimeout(ns_client_t *client, bool newconn) {
299 isc_result_t result;
300 isc_interval_t interval;
301 unsigned int ds;
302
303 if (newconn)
304 ds = client->sctx->initialtimo;
305 else if (USEKEEPALIVE(client))
306 ds = client->sctx->keepalivetimo;
307 else
308 ds = client->sctx->idletimo;
309
310 isc_interval_set(&interval, ds / 10, 100000000 * (ds % 10));
311 result = isc_timer_reset(client->timer, isc_timertype_once, NULL,
312 &interval, false);
313 client->timerset = true;
314 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS) {
315 ns_client_log(client, NS_LOGCATEGORY_CLIENT,
316 NS_LOGMODULE_CLIENT, ISC_LOG_ERROR,
317 "setting timeout: %s",
318 isc_result_totext(result));
319 /* Continue anyway. */
320 }
321}
322
323/*%
324 * Allocate a reference-counted object that will maintain a single pointer to
325 * the (also reference-counted) TCP client quota, shared between all the
326 * clients processing queries on a single TCP connection, so that all
327 * clients sharing the one socket will together consume only one slot in
328 * the 'tcp-clients' quota.
329 */
330static isc_result_t
331tcpconn_init(ns_client_t *client, bool force) {
332 isc_result_t result;
333 isc_quota_t *quota = NULL;
334 ns_tcpconn_t *tconn = NULL;
335
336 REQUIRE(client->tcpconn == NULL);
337
338 /*
339 * Try to attach to the quota first, so we won't pointlessly
340 * allocate memory for a tcpconn object if we can't get one.
341 */
342 if (force) {
343 result = isc_quota_force(&client->sctx->tcpquota, &quota);
344 } else {
345 result = isc_quota_attach(&client->sctx->tcpquota, &quota);
346 }
347 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS) {
348 return (result);
349 }
350
351 /*
352 * A global memory context is used for the allocation as different
353 * client structures may have different memory contexts assigned and a
354 * reference counter allocated here might need to be freed by a
355 * different client. The performance impact caused by memory context
356 * contention here is expected to be negligible, given that this code
357 * is only executed for TCP connections.
358 */
359 tconn = isc_mem_allocate(client->sctx->mctx, sizeof(*tconn));
360
361 isc_refcount_init(&tconn->refs, 1);
362 tconn->tcpquota = quota;
363 quota = NULL;
364 tconn->pipelined = false;
365
366 client->tcpconn = tconn;
367
368 return (ISC_R_SUCCESS);
369}
370
371/*%
372 * Increase the count of client structures sharing the TCP connection
373 * that 'source' is associated with; add a pointer to the same tcpconn
374 * to 'target', thus associating it with the same TCP connection.
375 */
376static void
377tcpconn_attach(ns_client_t *source, ns_client_t *target) {
378 int old_refs;
379
380 REQUIRE(source->tcpconn != NULL);
381 REQUIRE(target->tcpconn == NULL);
382 REQUIRE(source->tcpconn->pipelined);
383
384 old_refs = isc_refcount_increment(&source->tcpconn->refs);
385 INSIST(old_refs > 0);
386 target->tcpconn = source->tcpconn;
387}
388
389/*%
390 * Decrease the count of client structures sharing the TCP connection that
391 * 'client' is associated with. If this is the last client using this TCP
392 * connection, we detach from the TCP quota and free the tcpconn
393 * object. Either way, client->tcpconn is set to NULL.
394 */
395static void
396tcpconn_detach(ns_client_t *client) {
397 ns_tcpconn_t *tconn = NULL;
398 int old_refs;
399
400 REQUIRE(client->tcpconn != NULL);
401
402 tconn = client->tcpconn;
403 client->tcpconn = NULL;
404
405 old_refs = isc_refcount_decrement(&tconn->refs);
406 INSIST(old_refs > 0);
407
408 if (old_refs == 1) {
409 isc_quota_detach(&tconn->tcpquota);
410 isc_mem_free(client->sctx->mctx, tconn);
411 }
412}
413
414/*%
415 * Mark a client as active and increment the interface's 'ntcpactive'
416 * counter, as a signal that there is at least one client servicing
417 * TCP queries for the interface. If we reach the TCP client quota at
418 * some point, this will be used to determine whether a quota overrun
419 * should be permitted.
420 *
421 * Marking the client active with the 'tcpactive' flag ensures proper
422 * accounting, by preventing us from incrementing or decrementing
423 * 'ntcpactive' more than once per client.
424 */
425static void
426mark_tcp_active(ns_client_t *client, bool active) {
427 if (active && !client->tcpactive) {
428 atomic_fetch_add(&client->interface->ntcpactive, 1);
429 client->tcpactive = active;
430 } else if (!active && client->tcpactive) {
431 uint32_t old =
432 atomic_fetch_sub(&client->interface->ntcpactive, 1);
433 INSIST(old > 0);
434 client->tcpactive = active;
435 }
436}
437
438/*%
439 * Check for a deactivation or shutdown request and take appropriate
440 * action. Returns true if either is in progress; in this case
441 * the caller must no longer use the client object as it may have been
442 * freed.
443 */
444static bool
445exit_check(ns_client_t *client) {
446 bool destroy_manager = false;
447 ns_clientmgr_t *manager = NULL;
448
449 REQUIRE(NS_CLIENT_VALID(client));
450 manager = client->manager;
451
452 if (client->state <= client->newstate)
453 return (false); /* Business as usual. */
454
455 INSIST(client->newstate < NS_CLIENTSTATE_RECURSING);
456
457 /*
458 * We need to detach from the view early when shutting down
459 * the server to break the following vicious circle:
460 *
461 * - The resolver will not shut down until the view refcount is zero
462 * - The view refcount does not go to zero until all clients detach
463 * - The client does not detach from the view until references is zero
464 * - references does not go to zero until the resolver has shut down
465 *
466 * Keep the view attached until any outstanding updates complete.
467 */
468 if (client->nupdates == 0 &&
469 client->newstate == NS_CLIENTSTATE_FREED && client->view != NULL)
470 dns_view_detach(&client->view);
471
472 if (client->state == NS_CLIENTSTATE_WORKING ||
473 client->state == NS_CLIENTSTATE_RECURSING)
474 {
475 INSIST(client->newstate <= NS_CLIENTSTATE_READING);
476 /*
477 * Let the update processing complete.
478 */
479 if (client->nupdates > 0)
480 return (true);
481
482 /*
483 * We are trying to abort request processing.
484 */
485 if (client->nsends > 0) {
486 isc_socket_t *sock;
487 if (TCP_CLIENT(client))
488 sock = client->tcpsocket;
489 else
490 sock = client->udpsocket;
491 isc_socket_cancel(sock, client->task,
492 ISC_SOCKCANCEL_SEND);
493 }
494
495 if (! (client->nsends == 0 && client->nrecvs == 0 &&
496 client->references == 0))
497 {
498 /*
499 * Still waiting for I/O cancel completion.
500 * or lingering references.
501 */
502 return (true);
503 }
504
505 /*
506 * I/O cancel is complete. Burn down all state
507 * related to the current request. Ensure that
508 * the client is no longer on the recursing list.
509 *
510 * We need to check whether the client is still linked,
511 * because it may already have been removed from the
512 * recursing list by ns_client_killoldestquery()
513 */
514 if (client->state == NS_CLIENTSTATE_RECURSING) {
515 LOCK(&manager->reclock);
516 if (ISC_LINK_LINKED(client, rlink))
517 ISC_LIST_UNLINK(manager->recursing,
518 client, rlink);
519 UNLOCK(&manager->reclock);
520 }
521 ns_client_endrequest(client);
522
523 client->state = NS_CLIENTSTATE_READING;
524 INSIST(client->recursionquota == NULL);
525
526 if (NS_CLIENTSTATE_READING == client->newstate) {
527 INSIST(client->tcpconn != NULL);
528 if (!client->tcpconn->pipelined) {
529 client_read(client, false);
530 client->newstate = NS_CLIENTSTATE_MAX;
531 return (true); /* We're done. */
532 } else if (client->mortal) {
533 client->newstate = NS_CLIENTSTATE_INACTIVE;
534 } else
535 return (false);
536 }
537 }
538
539 if (client->state == NS_CLIENTSTATE_READING) {
540 /*
541 * We are trying to abort the current TCP connection,
542 * if any.
543 */
544 INSIST(client->recursionquota == NULL);
545 INSIST(client->newstate <= NS_CLIENTSTATE_READY);
546
547 if (client->nreads > 0) {
548 dns_tcpmsg_cancelread(&client->tcpmsg);
549 }
550
551 /* Still waiting for read cancel completion. */
552 if (client->nreads > 0) {
553 return (true);
554 }
555
556 if (client->tcpmsg_valid) {
557 dns_tcpmsg_invalidate(&client->tcpmsg);
558 client->tcpmsg_valid = false;
559 }
560
561 /*
562 * Soon the client will be ready to accept a new TCP
563 * connection or UDP request, but we may have enough
564 * clients doing that already. Check whether this client
565 * needs to remain active and allow it go inactive if
566 * not.
567 *
568 * UDP clients always go inactive at this point, but a TCP
569 * client may need to stay active and return to READY
570 * state if no other clients are available to listen
571 * for TCP requests on this interface.
572 *
573 * Regardless, if we're going to FREED state, that means
574 * the system is shutting down and we don't need to
575 * retain clients.
576 */
577 if (client->mortal && TCP_CLIENT(client) &&
578 client->newstate != NS_CLIENTSTATE_FREED &&
579 (client->sctx->options & NS_SERVER_CLIENTTEST) == 0 &&
580 atomic_load(&client->interface->ntcpaccepting) == 0)
581 {
582 /* Nobody else is accepting */
583 client->mortal = false;
584 client->newstate = NS_CLIENTSTATE_READY;
585 }
586
587 /*
588 * Detach from TCP connection and TCP client quota,
589 * if appropriate. If this is the last reference to
590 * the TCP connection in our pipeline group, the
591 * TCP quota slot will be released.
592 */
593 if (client->tcpconn) {
594 tcpconn_detach(client);
595 }
596
597 if (client->tcpsocket != NULL) {
598 CTRACE("closetcp");
599 isc_socket_detach(&client->tcpsocket);
600 mark_tcp_active(client, false);
601 }
602
603 if (client->timerset) {
604 (void)isc_timer_reset(client->timer,
605 isc_timertype_inactive,
606 NULL, NULL, true);
607 client->timerset = false;
608 }
609
610 client->peeraddr_valid = false;
611
612 client->state = NS_CLIENTSTATE_READY;
613
614 /*
615 * We don't need the client; send it to the inactive
616 * queue for recycling.
617 */
618 if (client->mortal) {
619 if (client->newstate > NS_CLIENTSTATE_INACTIVE) {
620 client->newstate = NS_CLIENTSTATE_INACTIVE;
621 }
622 }
623
624 if (NS_CLIENTSTATE_READY == client->newstate) {
625 if (TCP_CLIENT(client)) {
626 client_accept(client);
627 } else {
628 client_udprecv(client);
629 }
630 client->newstate = NS_CLIENTSTATE_MAX;
631 return (true);
632 }
633 }
634
635 if (client->state == NS_CLIENTSTATE_READY) {
636 INSIST(client->newstate <= NS_CLIENTSTATE_INACTIVE);
637
638 /*
639 * We are trying to enter the inactive state.
640 */
641 if (client->naccepts > 0) {
642 isc_socket_cancel(client->tcplistener, client->task,
643 ISC_SOCKCANCEL_ACCEPT);
644 }
645
646 /* Still waiting for accept cancel completion. */
647 if (client->naccepts > 0) {
648 return (true);
649 }
650
651 /* Accept cancel is complete. */
652 if (client->nrecvs > 0) {
653 isc_socket_cancel(client->udpsocket, client->task,
654 ISC_SOCKCANCEL_RECV);
655 }
656
657 /* Still waiting for recv cancel completion. */
658 if (client->nrecvs > 0) {
659 return (true);
660 }
661
662 /* Still waiting for control event to be delivered */
663 if (client->nctls > 0) {
664 return (true);
665 }
666
667 INSIST(client->naccepts == 0);
668 INSIST(client->recursionquota == NULL);
669 if (client->tcplistener != NULL) {
670 isc_socket_detach(&client->tcplistener);
671 mark_tcp_active(client, false);
672 }
673 if (client->udpsocket != NULL) {
674 isc_socket_detach(&client->udpsocket);
675 }
676
677 /* Deactivate the client. */
678 if (client->interface != NULL) {
679 ns_interface_detach(&client->interface);
680 }
681
682 if (client->dispatch != NULL) {
683 dns_dispatch_detach(&client->dispatch);
684 }
685
686 client->attributes = 0;
687 client->mortal = false;
688 client->sendcb = NULL;
689
690 if (client->keytag != NULL) {
691 isc_mem_put(client->mctx, client->keytag,
692 client->keytag_len);
693 client->keytag_len = 0;
694 }
695
696 /*
697 * Put the client on the inactive list. If we are aiming for
698 * the "freed" state, it will be removed from the inactive
699 * list shortly, and we need to keep the manager locked until
700 * that has been done, lest the manager decide to reactivate
701 * the dying client inbetween.
702 */
703 client->state = NS_CLIENTSTATE_INACTIVE;
704 INSIST(client->recursionquota == NULL);
705
706 if (client->state == client->newstate) {
707 client->newstate = NS_CLIENTSTATE_MAX;
708 if ((client->sctx->options &
709 NS_SERVER_CLIENTTEST) == 0 &&
710 manager != NULL && !manager->exiting)
711 {
712 ISC_QUEUE_PUSH(manager->inactive, client,
713 ilink);
714 }
715 if (client->needshutdown) {
716 isc_task_shutdown(client->task);
717 }
718 return (true);
719 }
720 }
721
722 if (client->state == NS_CLIENTSTATE_INACTIVE) {
723 INSIST(client->newstate == NS_CLIENTSTATE_FREED);
724 /*
725 * We are trying to free the client.
726 *
727 * When "shuttingdown" is true, either the task has received
728 * its shutdown event or no shutdown event has ever been
729 * set up. Thus, we have no outstanding shutdown
730 * event at this point.
731 */
732 REQUIRE(client->state == NS_CLIENTSTATE_INACTIVE);
733
734 INSIST(client->recursionquota == NULL);
735 INSIST(!ISC_QLINK_LINKED(client, ilink));
736
737 if (manager != NULL) {
738 LOCK(&manager->listlock);
739 ISC_LIST_UNLINK(manager->clients, client, link);
740 LOCK(&manager->lock);
741 if (manager->exiting &&
742 ISC_LIST_EMPTY(manager->clients))
743 destroy_manager = true;
744 UNLOCK(&manager->lock);
745 UNLOCK(&manager->listlock);
746 }
747
748 ns_query_free(client);
749 isc_mem_put(client->mctx, client->recvbuf, RECV_BUFFER_SIZE);
750 isc_event_free((isc_event_t **)&client->sendevent);
751 isc_event_free((isc_event_t **)&client->recvevent);
752 isc_timer_detach(&client->timer);
753 if (client->delaytimer != NULL)
754 isc_timer_detach(&client->delaytimer);
755
756 if (client->tcpbuf != NULL)
757 isc_mem_put(client->mctx, client->tcpbuf,
758 TCP_BUFFER_SIZE);
759 if (client->opt != NULL) {
760 INSIST(dns_rdataset_isassociated(client->opt));
761 dns_rdataset_disassociate(client->opt);
762 dns_message_puttemprdataset(client->message,
763 &client->opt);
764 }
765 if (client->keytag != NULL) {
766 isc_mem_put(client->mctx, client->keytag,
767 client->keytag_len);
768 client->keytag_len = 0;
769 }
770
771 dns_message_destroy(&client->message);
772
773 /*
774 * Detaching the task must be done after unlinking from
775 * the manager's lists because the manager accesses
776 * client->task.
777 */
778 if (client->task != NULL)
779 isc_task_detach(&client->task);
780
781 CTRACE("free");
782 client->magic = 0;
783
784 /*
785 * Check that there are no other external references to
786 * the memory context.
787 */
788 if ((client->sctx->options & NS_SERVER_CLIENTTEST) != 0 &&
789 isc_mem_references(client->mctx) != 1)
790 {
791 isc_mem_stats(client->mctx, stderr);
792 INSIST(0);
793 ISC_UNREACHABLE();
794 }
795
796 /*
797 * Destroy the fetchlock mutex that was created in
798 * ns_query_init().
799 */
800 isc_mutex_destroy(&client->query.fetchlock);
801
802 if (client->sctx != NULL)
803 ns_server_detach(&client->sctx);
804
805 isc_mem_putanddetach(&client->mctx, client, sizeof(*client));
806 }
807
808 if (destroy_manager && manager != NULL)
809 clientmgr_destroy(manager);
810
811 return (true);
812}
813
814/*%
815 * The client's task has received the client's control event
816 * as part of the startup process.
817 */
818static void
819client_start(isc_task_t *task, isc_event_t *event) {
820 ns_client_t *client = (ns_client_t *) event->ev_arg;
821
822 INSIST(task == client->task);
823
824 UNUSED(task);
825
826 INSIST(client->nctls == 1);
827 client->nctls--;
828
829 if (exit_check(client))
830 return;
831
832 if (TCP_CLIENT(client)) {
833 if (client->tcpconn != NULL) {
834 client_read(client, false);
835 } else {
836 client_accept(client);
837 }
838 } else {
839 client_udprecv(client);
840 }
841}
842
843/*%
844 * The client's task has received a shutdown event.
845 */
846static void
847client_shutdown(isc_task_t *task, isc_event_t *event) {
848 ns_client_t *client;
849
850 REQUIRE(event != NULL);
851 REQUIRE(event->ev_type == ISC_TASKEVENT_SHUTDOWN);
852 client = event->ev_arg;
853 REQUIRE(NS_CLIENT_VALID(client));
854 REQUIRE(task == client->task);
855
856 UNUSED(task);
857
858 CTRACE("shutdown");
859
860 isc_event_free(&event);
861
862 if (client->shutdown != NULL) {
863 (client->shutdown)(client->shutdown_arg, ISC_R_SHUTTINGDOWN);
864 client->shutdown = NULL;
865 client->shutdown_arg = NULL;
866 }
867
868 if (ISC_QLINK_LINKED(client, ilink))
869 ISC_QUEUE_UNLINK(client->manager->inactive, client, ilink);
870
871 client->newstate = NS_CLIENTSTATE_FREED;
872 client->needshutdown = false;
873 (void)exit_check(client);
874}
875
876static void
877ns_client_endrequest(ns_client_t *client) {
878 INSIST(client->naccepts == 0);
879 INSIST(client->nreads == 0);
880 INSIST(client->nsends == 0);
881 INSIST(client->nrecvs == 0);
882 INSIST(client->nupdates == 0);
883 INSIST(client->state == NS_CLIENTSTATE_WORKING ||
884 client->state == NS_CLIENTSTATE_RECURSING);
885
886 CTRACE("endrequest");
887
888 if (client->next != NULL) {
889 (client->next)(client);
890 client->next = NULL;
891 }
892
893 if (client->view != NULL) {
894#ifdef ENABLE_AFL
895 if (client->sctx->fuzztype == isc_fuzz_resolver) {
896 dns_cache_clean(client->view->cache, INT_MAX);
897 dns_adb_flush(client->view->adb);
898 }
899#endif
900 dns_view_detach(&client->view);
901 }
902 if (client->opt != NULL) {
903 INSIST(dns_rdataset_isassociated(client->opt));
904 dns_rdataset_disassociate(client->opt);
905 dns_message_puttemprdataset(client->message, &client->opt);
906 }
907
908 client->signer = NULL;
909 client->udpsize = 512;
910 client->extflags = 0;
911 client->ednsversion = -1;
912 dns_ecs_init(&client->ecs);
913 dns_message_reset(client->message, DNS_MESSAGE_INTENTPARSE);
914
915 if (client->recursionquota != NULL) {
916 isc_quota_detach(&client->recursionquota);
917 ns_stats_decrement(client->sctx->nsstats,
918 ns_statscounter_recursclients);
919 }
920
921 /*
922 * Clear all client attributes that are specific to
923 * the request; that's all except the TCP flag.
924 */
925 client->attributes &= NS_CLIENTATTR_TCP;
926#ifdef ENABLE_AFL
927 if (client->sctx->fuzznotify != NULL &&
928 (client->sctx->fuzztype == isc_fuzz_client ||
929 client->sctx->fuzztype == isc_fuzz_tcpclient ||
930 client->sctx->fuzztype == isc_fuzz_resolver))
931 {
932 client->sctx->fuzznotify();
933 }
934#endif /* ENABLE_AFL */
935
936}
937
938void
939ns_client_next(ns_client_t *client, isc_result_t result) {
940 int newstate;
941
942 REQUIRE(NS_CLIENT_VALID(client));
943 REQUIRE(client->state == NS_CLIENTSTATE_WORKING ||
944 client->state == NS_CLIENTSTATE_RECURSING ||
945 client->state == NS_CLIENTSTATE_READING);
946
947 CTRACE("next");
948
949 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS)
950 ns_client_log(client, DNS_LOGCATEGORY_SECURITY,
951 NS_LOGMODULE_CLIENT, ISC_LOG_DEBUG(3),
952 "request failed: %s", isc_result_totext(result));
953
954 /*
955 * An error processing a TCP request may have left
956 * the connection out of sync. To be safe, we always
957 * sever the connection when result != ISC_R_SUCCESS.
958 */
959 if (result == ISC_R_SUCCESS && TCP_CLIENT(client))
960 newstate = NS_CLIENTSTATE_READING;
961 else
962 newstate = NS_CLIENTSTATE_READY;
963
964 if (client->newstate > newstate)
965 client->newstate = newstate;
966 (void)exit_check(client);
967}
968
969
970static void
971client_senddone(isc_task_t *task, isc_event_t *event) {
972 ns_client_t *client;
973 isc_socketevent_t *sevent = (isc_socketevent_t *) event;
974
975 REQUIRE(sevent != NULL);
976 REQUIRE(sevent->ev_type == ISC_SOCKEVENT_SENDDONE);
977 client = sevent->ev_arg;
978 REQUIRE(NS_CLIENT_VALID(client));
979 REQUIRE(task == client->task);
980 REQUIRE(sevent == client->sendevent);
981
982 UNUSED(task);
983
984 CTRACE("senddone");
985
986 if (sevent->result != ISC_R_SUCCESS)
987 ns_client_log(client, NS_LOGCATEGORY_CLIENT,
988 NS_LOGMODULE_CLIENT, ISC_LOG_WARNING,
989 "error sending response: %s",
990 isc_result_totext(sevent->result));
991
992 INSIST(client->nsends > 0);
993 client->nsends--;
994
995 if (client->tcpbuf != NULL) {
996 INSIST(TCP_CLIENT(client));
997 isc_mem_put(client->mctx, client->tcpbuf, TCP_BUFFER_SIZE);
998 client->tcpbuf = NULL;
999 }
1000
1001 ns_client_next(client, ISC_R_SUCCESS);
1002}
1003
1004/*%
1005 * We only want to fail with ISC_R_NOSPACE when called from
1006 * ns_client_sendraw() and not when called from ns_client_send(),
1007 * tcpbuffer is NULL when called from ns_client_sendraw() and
1008 * length != 0. tcpbuffer != NULL when called from ns_client_send()
1009 * and length == 0.
1010 */
1011
1012static isc_result_t
1013client_allocsendbuf(ns_client_t *client, isc_buffer_t *buffer,
1014 isc_buffer_t *tcpbuffer, uint32_t length,
1015 unsigned char *sendbuf, unsigned char **datap)
1016{
1017 unsigned char *data;
1018 uint32_t bufsize;
1019 isc_result_t result;
1020
1021 INSIST(datap != NULL);
1022 INSIST((tcpbuffer == NULL && length != 0) ||
1023 (tcpbuffer != NULL && length == 0));
1024
1025 if (TCP_CLIENT(client)) {
1026 INSIST(client->tcpbuf == NULL);
1027 if (length + 2 > TCP_BUFFER_SIZE) {
1028 result = ISC_R_NOSPACE;
1029 goto done;
1030 }
1031 client->tcpbuf = isc_mem_get(client->mctx, TCP_BUFFER_SIZE);
1032 if (client->tcpbuf == NULL) {
1033 result = ISC_R_NOMEMORY;
1034 goto done;
1035 }
1036 data = client->tcpbuf;
1037 if (tcpbuffer != NULL) {
1038 isc_buffer_init(tcpbuffer, data, TCP_BUFFER_SIZE);
1039 isc_buffer_init(buffer, data + 2, TCP_BUFFER_SIZE - 2);
1040 } else {
1041 isc_buffer_init(buffer, data, TCP_BUFFER_SIZE);
1042 INSIST(length <= 0xffff);
1043 isc_buffer_putuint16(buffer, (uint16_t)length);
1044 }
1045 } else {
1046 data = sendbuf;
1047 if ((client->attributes & NS_CLIENTATTR_HAVECOOKIE) == 0) {
1048 if (client->view != NULL)
1049 bufsize = client->view->nocookieudp;
1050 else
1051 bufsize = 512;
1052 } else
1053 bufsize = client->udpsize;
1054 if (bufsize > client->udpsize)
1055 bufsize = client->udpsize;
1056 if (bufsize > SEND_BUFFER_SIZE)
1057 bufsize = SEND_BUFFER_SIZE;
1058 if (length > bufsize) {
1059 result = ISC_R_NOSPACE;
1060 goto done;
1061 }
1062 isc_buffer_init(buffer, data, bufsize);
1063 }
1064 *datap = data;
1065 result = ISC_R_SUCCESS;
1066
1067 done:
1068 return (result);
1069}
1070
1071static isc_result_t
1072client_sendpkg(ns_client_t *client, isc_buffer_t *buffer) {
1073 struct in6_pktinfo *pktinfo;
1074 isc_result_t result;
1075 isc_region_t r;
1076 isc_sockaddr_t *address;
1077 isc_socket_t *sock;
1078 isc_netaddr_t netaddr;
1079 int match;
1080 unsigned int sockflags = ISC_SOCKFLAG_IMMEDIATE;
1081 isc_dscp_t dispdscp = -1;
1082
1083 if (TCP_CLIENT(client)) {
1084 sock = client->tcpsocket;
1085 address = NULL;
1086 } else {
1087 dns_aclenv_t *env =
1088 ns_interfacemgr_getaclenv(client->interface->mgr);
1089
1090 sock = client->udpsocket;
1091 address = &client->peeraddr;
1092
1093 isc_netaddr_fromsockaddr(&netaddr, &client->peeraddr);
1094 if (client->sctx->blackholeacl != NULL &&
1095 (dns_acl_match(&netaddr, NULL, client->sctx->blackholeacl,
1096 env, &match, NULL) == ISC_R_SUCCESS) &&
1097 match > 0)
1098 {
1099 return (DNS_R_BLACKHOLED);
1100 }
1101 sockflags |= ISC_SOCKFLAG_NORETRY;
1102 }
1103
1104 if ((client->attributes & NS_CLIENTATTR_PKTINFO) != 0 &&
1105 (client->attributes & NS_CLIENTATTR_MULTICAST) == 0)
1106 pktinfo = &client->pktinfo;
1107 else
1108 pktinfo = NULL;
1109
1110 if (client->dispatch != NULL) {
1111 dispdscp = dns_dispatch_getdscp(client->dispatch);
1112 if (dispdscp != -1)
1113 client->dscp = dispdscp;
1114 }
1115
1116 if (client->dscp == -1) {
1117 client->sendevent->attributes &= ~ISC_SOCKEVENTATTR_DSCP;
1118 client->sendevent->dscp = 0;
1119 } else {
1120 client->sendevent->attributes |= ISC_SOCKEVENTATTR_DSCP;
1121 client->sendevent->dscp = client->dscp;
1122 }
1123
1124 isc_buffer_usedregion(buffer, &r);
1125
1126 /*
1127 * If this is a UDP client and the IPv6 packet can't be
1128 * encapsulated without generating a PTB on a 1500 octet
1129 * MTU link force fragmentation at 1280 if it is a IPv6
1130 * response.
1131 */
1132 client->sendevent->attributes &= ~ISC_SOCKEVENTATTR_USEMINMTU;
1133 if (!TCP_CLIENT(client) && r.length > 1432)
1134 client->sendevent->attributes |= ISC_SOCKEVENTATTR_USEMINMTU;
1135
1136 CTRACE("sendto");
1137
1138 result = isc_socket_sendto2(sock, &r, client->task,
1139 address, pktinfo,
1140 client->sendevent, sockflags);
1141 if (result == ISC_R_SUCCESS || result == ISC_R_INPROGRESS) {
1142 client->nsends++;
1143 if (result == ISC_R_SUCCESS)
1144 client_senddone(client->task,
1145 (isc_event_t *)client->sendevent);
1146 result = ISC_R_SUCCESS;
1147 }
1148 return (result);
1149}
1150
1151void
1152ns_client_sendraw(ns_client_t *client, dns_message_t *message) {
1153 isc_result_t result;
1154 unsigned char *data;
1155 isc_buffer_t buffer;
1156 isc_region_t r;
1157 isc_region_t *mr;
1158 unsigned char sendbuf[SEND_BUFFER_SIZE];
1159
1160 REQUIRE(NS_CLIENT_VALID(client));
1161
1162 CTRACE("sendraw");
1163
1164 mr = dns_message_getrawmessage(message);
1165 if (mr == NULL) {
1166 result = ISC_R_UNEXPECTEDEND;
1167 goto done;
1168 }
1169
1170 result = client_allocsendbuf(client, &buffer, NULL, mr->length,
1171 sendbuf, &data);
1172 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS)
1173 goto done;
1174
1175 /*
1176 * Copy message to buffer and fixup id.
1177 */
1178 isc_buffer_availableregion(&buffer, &r);
1179 result = isc_buffer_copyregion(&buffer, mr);
1180 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS)
1181 goto done;
1182 r.base[0] = (client->message->id >> 8) & 0xff;
1183 r.base[1] = client->message->id & 0xff;
1184
1185 result = client_sendpkg(client, &buffer);
1186 if (result == ISC_R_SUCCESS)
1187 return;
1188
1189 done:
1190 if (client->tcpbuf != NULL) {
1191 isc_mem_put(client->mctx, client->tcpbuf, TCP_BUFFER_SIZE);
1192 client->tcpbuf = NULL;
1193 }
1194 ns_client_next(client, result);
1195}
1196
1197static void
1198client_send(ns_client_t *client) {
1199 isc_result_t result;
1200 unsigned char *data;
1201 isc_buffer_t buffer;
1202 isc_buffer_t tcpbuffer;
1203 isc_region_t r;
1204 dns_compress_t cctx;
1205 bool cleanup_cctx = false;
1206 unsigned char sendbuf[SEND_BUFFER_SIZE];
1207 unsigned int render_opts;
1208 unsigned int preferred_glue;
1209 bool opt_included = false;
1210 size_t respsize;
1211 dns_aclenv_t *env = ns_interfacemgr_getaclenv(client->interface->mgr);
1212#ifdef HAVE_DNSTAP
1213 unsigned char zone[DNS_NAME_MAXWIRE];
1214 dns_dtmsgtype_t dtmsgtype;
1215 isc_region_t zr;
1216#endif /* HAVE_DNSTAP */
1217
1218 REQUIRE(NS_CLIENT_VALID(client));
1219
1220 CTRACE("send");
1221
1222 if (client->message->opcode == dns_opcode_query &&
1223 (client->attributes & NS_CLIENTATTR_RA) != 0)
1224 client->message->flags |= DNS_MESSAGEFLAG_RA;
1225
1226 if ((client->attributes & NS_CLIENTATTR_WANTDNSSEC) != 0)
1227 render_opts = 0;
1228 else
1229 render_opts = DNS_MESSAGERENDER_OMITDNSSEC;
1230
1231 preferred_glue = 0;
1232 if (client->view != NULL) {
1233 if (client->view->preferred_glue == dns_rdatatype_a)
1234 preferred_glue = DNS_MESSAGERENDER_PREFER_A;
1235 else if (client->view->preferred_glue == dns_rdatatype_aaaa)
1236 preferred_glue = DNS_MESSAGERENDER_PREFER_AAAA;
1237 }
1238 if (preferred_glue == 0) {
1239 if (isc_sockaddr_pf(&client->peeraddr) == AF_INET)
1240 preferred_glue = DNS_MESSAGERENDER_PREFER_A;
1241 else
1242 preferred_glue = DNS_MESSAGERENDER_PREFER_AAAA;
1243 }
1244
1245 /*
1246 * Create an OPT for our reply.
1247 */
1248 if ((client->attributes & NS_CLIENTATTR_WANTOPT) != 0) {
1249 result = ns_client_addopt(client, client->message,
1250 &client->opt);
1251 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS)
1252 goto done;
1253 }
1254
1255 /*
1256 * XXXRTH The following doesn't deal with TCP buffer resizing.
1257 */
1258 result = client_allocsendbuf(client, &buffer, &tcpbuffer, 0,
1259 sendbuf, &data);
1260 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS)
1261 goto done;
1262
1263 result = dns_compress_init(&cctx, -1, client->mctx);
1264 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS)
1265 goto done;
1266 if (client->peeraddr_valid && client->view != NULL) {
1267 isc_netaddr_t netaddr;
1268 dns_name_t *name = NULL;
1269
1270 isc_netaddr_fromsockaddr(&netaddr, &client->peeraddr);
1271 if (client->message->tsigkey != NULL)
1272 name = &client->message->tsigkey->name;
1273
1274 if (client->view->nocasecompress == NULL ||
1275 !dns_acl_allowed(&netaddr, name,
1276 client->view->nocasecompress, env))
1277 {
1278 dns_compress_setsensitive(&cctx, true);
1279 }
1280
1281 if (client->view->msgcompression == false) {
1282 dns_compress_disable(&cctx);
1283 }
1284 }
1285 cleanup_cctx = true;
1286
1287 result = dns_message_renderbegin(client->message, &cctx, &buffer);
1288 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS)
1289 goto done;
1290
1291 if (client->opt != NULL) {
1292 result = dns_message_setopt(client->message, client->opt);
1293 opt_included = true;
1294 client->opt = NULL;
1295 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS)
1296 goto done;
1297 }
1298 result = dns_message_rendersection(client->message,
1299 DNS_SECTION_QUESTION, 0);
1300 if (result == ISC_R_NOSPACE) {
1301 client->message->flags |= DNS_MESSAGEFLAG_TC;
1302 goto renderend;
1303 }
1304 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS)
1305 goto done;
1306 /*
1307 * Stop after the question if TC was set for rate limiting.
1308 */
1309 if ((client->message->flags & DNS_MESSAGEFLAG_TC) != 0)
1310 goto renderend;
1311 result = dns_message_rendersection(client->message,
1312 DNS_SECTION_ANSWER,
1313 DNS_MESSAGERENDER_PARTIAL |
1314 render_opts);
1315 if (result == ISC_R_NOSPACE) {
1316 client->message->flags |= DNS_MESSAGEFLAG_TC;
1317 goto renderend;
1318 }
1319 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS)
1320 goto done;
1321 result = dns_message_rendersection(client->message,
1322 DNS_SECTION_AUTHORITY,
1323 DNS_MESSAGERENDER_PARTIAL |
1324 render_opts);
1325 if (result == ISC_R_NOSPACE) {
1326 client->message->flags |= DNS_MESSAGEFLAG_TC;
1327 goto renderend;
1328 }
1329 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS)
1330 goto done;
1331 result = dns_message_rendersection(client->message,
1332 DNS_SECTION_ADDITIONAL,
1333 preferred_glue | render_opts);
1334 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS && result != ISC_R_NOSPACE)
1335 goto done;
1336 renderend:
1337 result = dns_message_renderend(client->message);
1338 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS)
1339 goto done;
1340
1341#ifdef HAVE_DNSTAP
1342 memset(&zr, 0, sizeof(zr));
1343 if (((client->message->flags & DNS_MESSAGEFLAG_AA) != 0) &&
1344 (client->query.authzone != NULL))
1345 {
1346 isc_buffer_t b;
1347 dns_name_t *zo =
1348 dns_zone_getorigin(client->query.authzone);
1349
1350 isc_buffer_init(&b, zone, sizeof(zone));
1351 dns_compress_setmethods(&cctx, DNS_COMPRESS_NONE);
1352 result = dns_name_towire(zo, &cctx, &b);
1353 if (result == ISC_R_SUCCESS)
1354 isc_buffer_usedregion(&b, &zr);
1355 }
1356
1357 if (client->message->opcode == dns_opcode_update) {
1358 dtmsgtype = DNS_DTTYPE_UR;
1359 } else if ((client->message->flags & DNS_MESSAGEFLAG_RD) != 0) {
1360 dtmsgtype = DNS_DTTYPE_CR;
1361 } else {
1362 dtmsgtype = DNS_DTTYPE_AR;
1363 }
1364#endif /* HAVE_DNSTAP */
1365
1366 if (cleanup_cctx) {
1367 dns_compress_invalidate(&cctx);
1368 cleanup_cctx = false;
1369 }
1370
1371 if (client->sendcb != NULL) {
1372 client->sendcb(&buffer);
1373 } else if (TCP_CLIENT(client)) {
1374 isc_buffer_usedregion(&buffer, &r);
1375 isc_buffer_putuint16(&tcpbuffer, (uint16_t) r.length);
1376 isc_buffer_add(&tcpbuffer, r.length);
1377#ifdef HAVE_DNSTAP
1378 if (client->view != NULL) {
1379 dns_dt_send(client->view, dtmsgtype,
1380 &client->peeraddr, &client->destsockaddr,
1381 true, &zr, &client->requesttime, NULL,
1382 &buffer);
1383 }
1384#endif /* HAVE_DNSTAP */
1385
1386 /* don't count the 2-octet length header */
1387 respsize = isc_buffer_usedlength(&tcpbuffer) - 2;
1388 result = client_sendpkg(client, &tcpbuffer);
1389
1390 switch (isc_sockaddr_pf(&client->peeraddr)) {
1391 case AF_INET:
1392 isc_stats_increment(client->sctx->tcpoutstats4,
1393 ISC_MIN((int)respsize / 16, 256));
1394 break;
1395 case AF_INET6:
1396 isc_stats_increment(client->sctx->tcpoutstats6,
1397 ISC_MIN((int)respsize / 16, 256));
1398 break;
1399 default:
1400 INSIST(0);
1401 ISC_UNREACHABLE();
1402 }
1403 } else {
1404#ifdef HAVE_DNSTAP
1405 /*
1406 * Log dnstap data first, because client_sendpkg() may
1407 * leave client->view set to NULL.
1408 */
1409 if (client->view != NULL) {
1410 dns_dt_send(client->view, dtmsgtype,
1411 &client->peeraddr,
1412 &client->destsockaddr,
1413 false, &zr,
1414 &client->requesttime, NULL, &buffer);
1415 }
1416#endif /* HAVE_DNSTAP */
1417
1418 respsize = isc_buffer_usedlength(&buffer);
1419 result = client_sendpkg(client, &buffer);
1420
1421 switch (isc_sockaddr_pf(&client->peeraddr)) {
1422 case AF_INET:
1423 isc_stats_increment(client->sctx->udpoutstats4,
1424 ISC_MIN((int)respsize / 16, 256));
1425 break;
1426 case AF_INET6:
1427 isc_stats_increment(client->sctx->udpoutstats6,
1428 ISC_MIN((int)respsize / 16, 256));
1429 break;
1430 default:
1431 INSIST(0);
1432 ISC_UNREACHABLE();
1433 }
1434 }
1435
1436 /* update statistics (XXXJT: is it okay to access message->xxxkey?) */
1437 ns_stats_increment(client->sctx->nsstats, ns_statscounter_response);
1438
1439 dns_rcodestats_increment(client->sctx->rcodestats,
1440 client->message->rcode);
1441 if (opt_included) {
1442 ns_stats_increment(client->sctx->nsstats,
1443 ns_statscounter_edns0out);
1444 }
1445 if (client->message->tsigkey != NULL) {
1446 ns_stats_increment(client->sctx->nsstats,
1447 ns_statscounter_tsigout);
1448 }
1449 if (client->message->sig0key != NULL) {
1450 ns_stats_increment(client->sctx->nsstats,
1451 ns_statscounter_sig0out);
1452 }
1453 if ((client->message->flags & DNS_MESSAGEFLAG_TC) != 0)
1454 ns_stats_increment(client->sctx->nsstats,
1455 ns_statscounter_truncatedresp);
1456
1457 if (result == ISC_R_SUCCESS)
1458 return;
1459
1460 done:
1461 if (client->tcpbuf != NULL) {
1462 isc_mem_put(client->mctx, client->tcpbuf, TCP_BUFFER_SIZE);
1463 client->tcpbuf = NULL;
1464 }
1465
1466 if (cleanup_cctx)
1467 dns_compress_invalidate(&cctx);
1468
1469 ns_client_next(client, result);
1470}
1471
1472/*
1473 * Completes the sending of a delayed client response.
1474 */
1475static void
1476client_delay(isc_task_t *task, isc_event_t *event) {
1477 ns_client_t *client;
1478
1479 REQUIRE(event != NULL);
1480 REQUIRE(event->ev_type == ISC_TIMEREVENT_LIFE ||
1481 event->ev_type == ISC_TIMEREVENT_IDLE);
1482 client = event->ev_arg;
1483 REQUIRE(NS_CLIENT_VALID(client));
1484 REQUIRE(task == client->task);
1485 REQUIRE(client->delaytimer != NULL);
1486
1487 UNUSED(task);
1488
1489 CTRACE("client_delay");
1490
1491 isc_event_free(&event);
1492 isc_timer_detach(&client->delaytimer);
1493
1494 client_send(client);
1495 ns_client_detach(&client);
1496}
1497
1498void
1499ns_client_send(ns_client_t *client) {
1500 /*
1501 * Delay the response according to the -T delay option
1502 */
1503 if (client->sctx->delay != 0) {
1504 ns_client_t *dummy = NULL;
1505 isc_result_t result;
1506 isc_interval_t interval;
1507
1508 /*
1509 * Replace ourselves if we have not already been replaced.
1510 */
1511 if (!client->mortal) {
1512 result = ns_client_replace(client);
1513 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS)
1514 goto nodelay;
1515 }
1516
1517 ns_client_attach(client, &dummy);
1518 if (client->sctx->delay >= 1000)
1519 isc_interval_set(&interval, client->sctx->delay / 1000,
1520 (client->sctx->delay % 1000) * 1000000);
1521 else
1522 isc_interval_set(&interval, 0,
1523 client->sctx->delay * 1000000);
1524 result = isc_timer_create(client->manager->timermgr,
1525 isc_timertype_once, NULL, &interval,
1526 client->task, client_delay,
1527 client, &client->delaytimer);
1528 if (result == ISC_R_SUCCESS)
1529 return;
1530
1531 ns_client_detach(&dummy);
1532 }
1533
1534 nodelay:
1535 client_send(client);
1536}
1537
1538#if NS_CLIENT_DROPPORT
1539#define DROPPORT_NO 0
1540#define DROPPORT_REQUEST 1
1541#define DROPPORT_RESPONSE 2
1542/*%
1543 * ns_client_dropport determines if certain requests / responses
1544 * should be dropped based on the port number.
1545 *
1546 * Returns:
1547 * \li 0: Don't drop.
1548 * \li 1: Drop request.
1549 * \li 2: Drop (error) response.
1550 */
1551static int
1552ns_client_dropport(in_port_t port) {
1553 switch (port) {
1554 case 7: /* echo */
1555 case 13: /* daytime */
1556 case 19: /* chargen */
1557 case 37: /* time */
1558 return (DROPPORT_REQUEST);
1559 case 464: /* kpasswd */
1560 return (DROPPORT_RESPONSE);
1561 }
1562 return (DROPPORT_NO);
1563}
1564#endif
1565
1566void
1567ns_client_error(ns_client_t *client, isc_result_t result) {
1568 dns_rcode_t rcode;
1569 dns_message_t *message;
1570
1571 REQUIRE(NS_CLIENT_VALID(client));
1572
1573 CTRACE("error");
1574
1575 message = client->message;
1576 rcode = dns_result_torcode(result);
1577
1578#if NS_CLIENT_DROPPORT
1579 /*
1580 * Don't send FORMERR to ports on the drop port list.
1581 */
1582 if (rcode == dns_rcode_formerr &&
1583 ns_client_dropport(isc_sockaddr_getport(&client->peeraddr)) !=
1584 DROPPORT_NO) {
1585 char buf[64];
1586 isc_buffer_t b;
1587
1588 isc_buffer_init(&b, buf, sizeof(buf) - 1);
1589 if (dns_rcode_totext(rcode, &b) != ISC_R_SUCCESS)
1590 isc_buffer_putstr(&b, "UNKNOWN RCODE");
1591 ns_client_log(client, DNS_LOGCATEGORY_SECURITY,
1592 NS_LOGMODULE_CLIENT, ISC_LOG_DEBUG(10),
1593 "dropped error (%.*s) response: suspicious port",
1594 (int)isc_buffer_usedlength(&b), buf);
1595 ns_client_next(client, ISC_R_SUCCESS);
1596 return;
1597 }
1598#endif
1599
1600 /*
1601 * Try to rate limit error responses.
1602 */
1603 if (client->view != NULL && client->view->rrl != NULL) {
1604 bool wouldlog;
1605 char log_buf[DNS_RRL_LOG_BUF_LEN];
1606 dns_rrl_result_t rrl_result;
1607 int loglevel;
1608
1609 INSIST(rcode != dns_rcode_noerror &&
1610 rcode != dns_rcode_nxdomain);
1611 if ((client->sctx->options & NS_SERVER_LOGQUERIES) != 0)
1612 loglevel = DNS_RRL_LOG_DROP;
1613 else
1614 loglevel = ISC_LOG_DEBUG(1);
1615 wouldlog = isc_log_wouldlog(ns_lctx, loglevel);
1616 rrl_result = dns_rrl(client->view, &client->peeraddr,
1617 TCP_CLIENT(client),
1618 dns_rdataclass_in, dns_rdatatype_none,
1619 NULL, result, client->now,
1620 wouldlog, log_buf, sizeof(log_buf));
1621 if (rrl_result != DNS_RRL_RESULT_OK) {
1622 /*
1623 * Log dropped errors in the query category
1624 * so that they are not lost in silence.
1625 * Starts of rate-limited bursts are logged in
1626 * NS_LOGCATEGORY_RRL.
1627 */
1628 if (wouldlog) {
1629 ns_client_log(client,
1630 NS_LOGCATEGORY_QUERY_ERRORS,
1631 NS_LOGMODULE_CLIENT,
1632 loglevel,
1633 "%s", log_buf);
1634 }
1635 /*
1636 * Some error responses cannot be 'slipped',
1637 * so don't try to slip any error responses.
1638 */
1639 if (!client->view->rrl->log_only) {
1640 ns_stats_increment(client->sctx->nsstats,
1641 ns_statscounter_ratedropped);
1642 ns_stats_increment(client->sctx->nsstats,
1643 ns_statscounter_dropped);
1644 ns_client_next(client, DNS_R_DROP);
1645 return;
1646 }
1647 }
1648 }
1649
1650 /*
1651 * Message may be an in-progress reply that we had trouble
1652 * with, in which case QR will be set. We need to clear QR before
1653 * calling dns_message_reply() to avoid triggering an assertion.
1654 */
1655 message->flags &= ~DNS_MESSAGEFLAG_QR;
1656 /*
1657 * AA and AD shouldn't be set.
1658 */
1659 message->flags &= ~(DNS_MESSAGEFLAG_AA | DNS_MESSAGEFLAG_AD);
1660 result = dns_message_reply(message, true);
1661 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS) {
1662 /*
1663 * It could be that we've got a query with a good header,
1664 * but a bad question section, so we try again with
1665 * want_question_section set to false.
1666 */
1667 result = dns_message_reply(message, false);
1668 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS) {
1669 ns_client_next(client, result);
1670 return;
1671 }
1672 }
1673 message->rcode = rcode;
1674
1675 if (rcode == dns_rcode_formerr) {
1676 /*
1677 * FORMERR loop avoidance: If we sent a FORMERR message
1678 * with the same ID to the same client less than two
1679 * seconds ago, assume that we are in an infinite error
1680 * packet dialog with a server for some protocol whose
1681 * error responses look enough like DNS queries to
1682 * elicit a FORMERR response. Drop a packet to break
1683 * the loop.
1684 */
1685 if (isc_sockaddr_equal(&client->peeraddr,
1686 &client->formerrcache.addr) &&
1687 message->id == client->formerrcache.id &&
1688 (isc_time_seconds(&client->requesttime) -
1689 client->formerrcache.time) < 2)
1690 {
1691 /* Drop packet. */
1692 ns_client_log(client, NS_LOGCATEGORY_CLIENT,
1693 NS_LOGMODULE_CLIENT, ISC_LOG_DEBUG(1),
1694 "possible error packet loop, "
1695 "FORMERR dropped");
1696 ns_client_next(client, result);
1697 return;
1698 }
1699 client->formerrcache.addr = client->peeraddr;
1700 client->formerrcache.time =
1701 isc_time_seconds(&client->requesttime);
1702 client->formerrcache.id = message->id;
1703 } else if (rcode == dns_rcode_servfail && client->query.qname != NULL &&
1704 client->view != NULL && client->view->fail_ttl != 0 &&
1705 ((client->attributes & NS_CLIENTATTR_NOSETFC) == 0))
1706 {
1707 /*
1708 * SERVFAIL caching: store qname/qtype of failed queries
1709 */
1710 isc_time_t expire;
1711 isc_interval_t i;
1712 uint32_t flags = 0;
1713
1714 if ((message->flags & DNS_MESSAGEFLAG_CD) != 0)
1715 flags = NS_FAILCACHE_CD;
1716
1717 isc_interval_set(&i, client->view->fail_ttl, 0);
1718 result = isc_time_nowplusinterval(&expire, &i);
1719 if (result == ISC_R_SUCCESS)
1720 dns_badcache_add(client->view->failcache,
1721 client->query.qname,
1722 client->query.qtype,
1723 true, flags, &expire);
1724 }
1725 ns_client_send(client);
1726}
1727
1728isc_result_t
1729ns_client_addopt(ns_client_t *client, dns_message_t *message,
1730 dns_rdataset_t **opt)
1731{
1732 unsigned char ecs[ECS_SIZE];
1733 char nsid[BUFSIZ], *nsidp;
1734 unsigned char cookie[COOKIE_SIZE];
1735 isc_result_t result;
1736 dns_view_t *view;
1737 dns_resolver_t *resolver;
1738 uint16_t udpsize;
1739 dns_ednsopt_t ednsopts[DNS_EDNSOPTIONS];
1740 int count = 0;
1741 unsigned int flags;
1742 unsigned char expire[4];
1743 unsigned char advtimo[2];
1744 dns_aclenv_t *env = ns_interfacemgr_getaclenv(client->interface->mgr);
1745
1746 REQUIRE(NS_CLIENT_VALID(client));
1747 REQUIRE(opt != NULL && *opt == NULL);
1748 REQUIRE(message != NULL);
1749
1750 view = client->view;
1751 resolver = (view != NULL) ? view->resolver : NULL;
1752 if (resolver != NULL)
1753 udpsize = dns_resolver_getudpsize(resolver);
1754 else
1755 udpsize = client->sctx->udpsize;
1756
1757 flags = client->extflags & DNS_MESSAGEEXTFLAG_REPLYPRESERVE;
1758
1759 /* Set EDNS options if applicable */
1760 if (WANTNSID(client)) {
1761 if (client->sctx->server_id != NULL) {
1762 nsidp = client->sctx->server_id;
1763 } else if (client->sctx->gethostname != NULL) {
1764 result = client->sctx->gethostname(nsid, sizeof(nsid));
1765 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS) {
1766 goto no_nsid;
1767 }
1768 nsidp = nsid;
1769 } else {
1770 goto no_nsid;
1771 }
1772
1773 INSIST(count < DNS_EDNSOPTIONS);
1774 ednsopts[count].code = DNS_OPT_NSID;
1775 ednsopts[count].length = (uint16_t)strlen(nsidp);
1776 ednsopts[count].value = (unsigned char *)nsidp;
1777 count++;
1778 }
1779 no_nsid:
1780 if ((client->attributes & NS_CLIENTATTR_WANTCOOKIE) != 0) {
1781 isc_buffer_t buf;
1782 isc_stdtime_t now;
1783 uint32_t nonce;
1784
1785 isc_buffer_init(&buf, cookie, sizeof(cookie));
1786 isc_stdtime_get(&now);
1787
1788 isc_random_buf(&nonce, sizeof(nonce));
1789
1790 compute_cookie(client, now, nonce, client->sctx->secret, &buf);
1791
1792 INSIST(count < DNS_EDNSOPTIONS);
1793 ednsopts[count].code = DNS_OPT_COOKIE;
1794 ednsopts[count].length = COOKIE_SIZE;
1795 ednsopts[count].value = cookie;
1796 count++;
1797 }
1798 if ((client->attributes & NS_CLIENTATTR_HAVEEXPIRE) != 0) {
1799 isc_buffer_t buf;
1800
1801 INSIST(count < DNS_EDNSOPTIONS);
1802
1803 isc_buffer_init(&buf, expire, sizeof(expire));
1804 isc_buffer_putuint32(&buf, client->expire);
1805 ednsopts[count].code = DNS_OPT_EXPIRE;
1806 ednsopts[count].length = 4;
1807 ednsopts[count].value = expire;
1808 count++;
1809 }
1810 if (((client->attributes & NS_CLIENTATTR_HAVEECS) != 0) &&
1811 (client->ecs.addr.family == AF_INET ||
1812 client->ecs.addr.family == AF_INET6 ||
1813 client->ecs.addr.family == AF_UNSPEC))
1814 {
1815 isc_buffer_t buf;
1816 uint8_t addr[16];
1817 uint32_t plen, addrl;
1818 uint16_t family = 0;
1819
1820 /* Add CLIENT-SUBNET option. */
1821
1822 plen = client->ecs.source;
1823
1824 /* Round up prefix len to a multiple of 8 */
1825 addrl = (plen + 7) / 8;
1826
1827 switch (client->ecs.addr.family) {
1828 case AF_UNSPEC:
1829 INSIST(plen == 0);
1830 family = 0;
1831 break;
1832 case AF_INET:
1833 INSIST(plen <= 32);
1834 family = 1;
1835 memmove(addr, &client->ecs.addr.type, addrl);
1836 break;
1837 case AF_INET6:
1838 INSIST(plen <= 128);
1839 family = 2;
1840 memmove(addr, &client->ecs.addr.type, addrl);
1841 break;
1842 default:
1843 INSIST(0);
1844 ISC_UNREACHABLE();
1845 }
1846
1847 isc_buffer_init(&buf, ecs, sizeof(ecs));
1848 /* family */
1849 isc_buffer_putuint16(&buf, family);
1850 /* source prefix-length */
1851 isc_buffer_putuint8(&buf, client->ecs.source);
1852 /* scope prefix-length */
1853 isc_buffer_putuint8(&buf, client->ecs.scope);
1854
1855 /* address */
1856 if (addrl > 0) {
1857 /* Mask off last address byte */
1858 if ((plen % 8) != 0)
1859 addr[addrl - 1] &=
1860 ~0U << (8 - (plen % 8));
1861 isc_buffer_putmem(&buf, addr,
1862 (unsigned) addrl);
1863 }
1864
1865 ednsopts[count].code = DNS_OPT_CLIENT_SUBNET;
1866 ednsopts[count].length = addrl + 4;
1867 ednsopts[count].value = ecs;
1868 count++;
1869 }
1870 if (TCP_CLIENT(client) && USEKEEPALIVE(client)) {
1871 isc_buffer_t buf;
1872
1873 INSIST(count < DNS_EDNSOPTIONS);
1874
1875 isc_buffer_init(&buf, advtimo, sizeof(advtimo));
1876 isc_buffer_putuint16(&buf,
1877 (uint16_t) client->sctx->advertisedtimo);
1878 ednsopts[count].code = DNS_OPT_TCP_KEEPALIVE;
1879 ednsopts[count].length = 2;
1880 ednsopts[count].value = advtimo;
1881 count++;
1882 }
1883
1884 /* Padding must be added last */
1885 if ((view != NULL) && (view->padding > 0) && WANTPAD(client) &&
1886 (TCP_CLIENT(client) ||
1887 ((client->attributes & NS_CLIENTATTR_HAVECOOKIE) != 0)))
1888 {
1889 isc_netaddr_t netaddr;
1890 int match;
1891
1892 isc_netaddr_fromsockaddr(&netaddr, &client->peeraddr);
1893 result = dns_acl_match(&netaddr, NULL, view->pad_acl,
1894 env, &match, NULL);
1895 if (result == ISC_R_SUCCESS && match > 0) {
1896 INSIST(count < DNS_EDNSOPTIONS);
1897
1898 ednsopts[count].code = DNS_OPT_PAD;
1899 ednsopts[count].length = 0;
1900 ednsopts[count].value = NULL;
1901 count++;
1902
1903 dns_message_setpadding(message, view->padding);
1904 }
1905 }
1906
1907 result = dns_message_buildopt(message, opt, 0, udpsize, flags,
1908 ednsopts, count);
1909 return (result);
1910}
1911
1912static void
1913compute_cookie(ns_client_t *client, uint32_t when, uint32_t nonce,
1914 const unsigned char *secret, isc_buffer_t *buf)
1915{
1916 switch (client->sctx->cookiealg) {
1917 case ns_cookiealg_aes: {
1918 unsigned char digest[ISC_AES_BLOCK_LENGTH];
1919 unsigned char input[4 + 4 + 16];
1920 isc_netaddr_t netaddr;
1921 unsigned char *cp;
1922 unsigned int i;
1923
1924 memset(input, 0, sizeof(input));
1925 cp = isc_buffer_used(buf);
1926 isc_buffer_putmem(buf, client->cookie, 8);
1927 isc_buffer_putuint32(buf, nonce);
1928 isc_buffer_putuint32(buf, when);
1929 memmove(input, cp, 16);
1930 isc_aes128_crypt(secret, input, digest);
1931 for (i = 0; i < 8; i++)
1932 input[i] = digest[i] ^ digest[i + 8];
1933 isc_netaddr_fromsockaddr(&netaddr, &client->peeraddr);
1934 switch (netaddr.family) {
1935 case AF_INET:
1936 cp = (unsigned char *)&netaddr.type.in;
1937 memmove(input + 8, cp, 4);
1938 memset(input + 12, 0, 4);
1939 isc_aes128_crypt(secret, input, digest);
1940 break;
1941 case AF_INET6:
1942 cp = (unsigned char *)&netaddr.type.in6;
1943 memmove(input + 8, cp, 16);
1944 isc_aes128_crypt(secret, input, digest);
1945 for (i = 0; i < 8; i++)
1946 input[i + 8] = digest[i] ^ digest[i + 8];
1947 isc_aes128_crypt(client->sctx->secret, input + 8,
1948 digest);
1949 break;
1950 }
1951 for (i = 0; i < 8; i++)
1952 digest[i] ^= digest[i + 8];
1953 isc_buffer_putmem(buf, digest, 8);
1954 break;
1955 }
1956
1957 case ns_cookiealg_sha1:
1958 case ns_cookiealg_sha256: {
1959 unsigned char digest[ISC_MAX_MD_SIZE];
1960 unsigned char input[8 + 4 + 4 + 16];
1961 isc_netaddr_t netaddr;
1962 unsigned char *cp;
1963 unsigned int length = 0;
1964 isc_md_type_t md_type =
1965 (client->sctx->cookiealg == ns_cookiealg_sha1)
1966 ? ISC_MD_SHA1
1967 : ISC_MD_SHA256;
1968 unsigned int secret_len = isc_md_type_get_size(md_type);
1969
1970 cp = isc_buffer_used(buf);
1971 isc_buffer_putmem(buf, client->cookie, 8);
1972 isc_buffer_putuint32(buf, nonce);
1973 isc_buffer_putuint32(buf, when);
1974 memmove(input, cp, 16);
1975
1976 isc_netaddr_fromsockaddr(&netaddr, &client->peeraddr);
1977 switch (netaddr.family) {
1978 case AF_INET:
1979 memmove(input + 16,
1980 (unsigned char *)&netaddr.type.in, 4);
1981 length = 16 + 4;
1982 break;
1983 case AF_INET6:
1984 memmove(input + 16,
1985 (unsigned char *)&netaddr.type.in6, 16);
1986 length = 16 + 16;
1987 break;
1988 default:
1989 INSIST(0);
1990 ISC_UNREACHABLE();
1991 }
1992
1993 /*
1994 * XXXOND: Feels wrong to assert on cookie calculation failure
1995 */
1996 RUNTIME_CHECK(isc_hmac(md_type, secret, secret_len,
1997 input, length,
1998 digest, NULL) == ISC_R_SUCCESS);
1999
2000 isc_buffer_putmem(buf, digest, 8);
2001 break;
2002 }
2003
2004 default:
2005 INSIST(0);
2006 ISC_UNREACHABLE();
2007 }
2008}
2009
2010static void
2011process_cookie(ns_client_t *client, isc_buffer_t *buf, size_t optlen) {
2012 ns_altsecret_t *altsecret;
2013 unsigned char dbuf[COOKIE_SIZE];
2014 unsigned char *old;
2015 isc_stdtime_t now;
2016 uint32_t when;
2017 uint32_t nonce;
2018 isc_buffer_t db;
2019
2020 /*
2021 * If we have already seen a cookie option skip this cookie option.
2022 */
2023 if ((!client->sctx->answercookie) ||
2024 (client->attributes & NS_CLIENTATTR_WANTCOOKIE) != 0)
2025 {
2026 isc_buffer_forward(buf, (unsigned int)optlen);
2027 return;
2028 }
2029
2030 client->attributes |= NS_CLIENTATTR_WANTCOOKIE;
2031
2032 ns_stats_increment(client->sctx->nsstats, ns_statscounter_cookiein);
2033
2034 if (optlen != COOKIE_SIZE) {
2035 /*
2036 * Not our token.
2037 */
2038 INSIST(optlen >= 8U);
2039 memmove(client->cookie, isc_buffer_current(buf), 8);
2040 isc_buffer_forward(buf, (unsigned int)optlen);
2041
2042 if (optlen == 8U)
2043 ns_stats_increment(client->sctx->nsstats,
2044 ns_statscounter_cookienew);
2045 else
2046 ns_stats_increment(client->sctx->nsstats,
2047 ns_statscounter_cookiebadsize);
2048 return;
2049 }
2050
2051 /*
2052 * Process all of the incoming buffer.
2053 */
2054 old = isc_buffer_current(buf);
2055 memmove(client->cookie, old, 8);
2056 isc_buffer_forward(buf, 8);
2057 nonce = isc_buffer_getuint32(buf);
2058 when = isc_buffer_getuint32(buf);
2059 isc_buffer_forward(buf, 8);
2060
2061 /*
2062 * Allow for a 5 minute clock skew between servers sharing a secret.
2063 * Only accept COOKIE if we have talked to the client in the last hour.
2064 */
2065 isc_stdtime_get(&now);
2066 if (isc_serial_gt(when, (now + 300)) || /* In the future. */
2067 isc_serial_lt(when, (now - 3600))) { /* In the past. */
2068 ns_stats_increment(client->sctx->nsstats,
2069 ns_statscounter_cookiebadtime);
2070 return;
2071 }
2072
2073 isc_buffer_init(&db, dbuf, sizeof(dbuf));
2074 compute_cookie(client, when, nonce, client->sctx->secret, &db);
2075
2076 if (isc_safe_memequal(old, dbuf, COOKIE_SIZE)) {
2077 ns_stats_increment(client->sctx->nsstats,
2078 ns_statscounter_cookiematch);
2079 client->attributes |= NS_CLIENTATTR_HAVECOOKIE;
2080 return;
2081 }
2082
2083 for (altsecret = ISC_LIST_HEAD(client->sctx->altsecrets);
2084 altsecret != NULL;
2085 altsecret = ISC_LIST_NEXT(altsecret, link))
2086 {
2087 isc_buffer_init(&db, dbuf, sizeof(dbuf));
2088 compute_cookie(client, when, nonce, altsecret->secret, &db);
2089 if (isc_safe_memequal(old, dbuf, COOKIE_SIZE)) {
2090 ns_stats_increment(client->sctx->nsstats,
2091 ns_statscounter_cookiematch);
2092 client->attributes |= NS_CLIENTATTR_HAVECOOKIE;
2093 return;
2094 }
2095 }
2096
2097 ns_stats_increment(client->sctx->nsstats,
2098 ns_statscounter_cookienomatch);
2099}
2100
2101static isc_result_t
2102process_ecs(ns_client_t *client, isc_buffer_t *buf, size_t optlen) {
2103 uint16_t family;
2104 uint8_t addrlen, addrbytes, scope, *paddr;
2105 isc_netaddr_t caddr;
2106
2107 /*
2108 * If we have already seen a ECS option skip this ECS option.
2109 */
2110 if ((client->attributes & NS_CLIENTATTR_HAVEECS) != 0) {
2111 isc_buffer_forward(buf, (unsigned int)optlen);
2112 return (ISC_R_SUCCESS);
2113 }
2114
2115 /*
2116 * XXXMUKS: Is there any need to repeat these checks here
2117 * (except query's scope length) when they are done in the OPT
2118 * RDATA fromwire code?
2119 */
2120
2121 if (optlen < 4U) {
2122 ns_client_log(client, NS_LOGCATEGORY_CLIENT,
2123 NS_LOGMODULE_CLIENT, ISC_LOG_DEBUG(2),
2124 "EDNS client-subnet option too short");
2125 return (DNS_R_FORMERR);
2126 }
2127
2128 family = isc_buffer_getuint16(buf);
2129 addrlen = isc_buffer_getuint8(buf);
2130 scope = isc_buffer_getuint8(buf);
2131 optlen -= 4;
2132
2133 if (scope != 0U) {
2134 ns_client_log(client, NS_LOGCATEGORY_CLIENT,
2135 NS_LOGMODULE_CLIENT, ISC_LOG_DEBUG(2),
2136 "EDNS client-subnet option: invalid scope");
2137 return (DNS_R_OPTERR);
2138 }
2139
2140 memset(&caddr, 0, sizeof(caddr));
2141 switch (family) {
2142 case 0:
2143 /*
2144 * XXXMUKS: In queries, if FAMILY is set to 0, SOURCE
2145 * PREFIX-LENGTH must be 0 and ADDRESS should not be
2146 * present as the address and prefix lengths don't make
2147 * sense because the family is unknown.
2148 */
2149 if (addrlen != 0U) {
2150 ns_client_log(client, NS_LOGCATEGORY_CLIENT,
2151 NS_LOGMODULE_CLIENT, ISC_LOG_DEBUG(2),
2152 "EDNS client-subnet option: invalid "
2153 "address length (%u) for FAMILY=0",
2154 addrlen);
2155 return (DNS_R_OPTERR);
2156 }
2157 caddr.family = AF_UNSPEC;
2158 break;
2159 case 1:
2160 if (addrlen > 32U) {
2161 ns_client_log(client, NS_LOGCATEGORY_CLIENT,
2162 NS_LOGMODULE_CLIENT, ISC_LOG_DEBUG(2),
2163 "EDNS client-subnet option: invalid "
2164 "address length (%u) for IPv4",
2165 addrlen);
2166 return (DNS_R_OPTERR);
2167 }
2168 caddr.family = AF_INET;
2169 break;
2170 case 2:
2171 if (addrlen > 128U) {
2172 ns_client_log(client, NS_LOGCATEGORY_CLIENT,
2173 NS_LOGMODULE_CLIENT, ISC_LOG_DEBUG(2),
2174 "EDNS client-subnet option: invalid "
2175 "address length (%u) for IPv6",
2176 addrlen);
2177 return (DNS_R_OPTERR);
2178 }
2179 caddr.family = AF_INET6;
2180 break;
2181 default:
2182 ns_client_log(client, NS_LOGCATEGORY_CLIENT,
2183 NS_LOGMODULE_CLIENT, ISC_LOG_DEBUG(2),
2184 "EDNS client-subnet option: invalid family");
2185 return (DNS_R_OPTERR);
2186 }
2187
2188 addrbytes = (addrlen + 7) / 8;
2189 if (isc_buffer_remaininglength(buf) < addrbytes) {
2190 ns_client_log(client, NS_LOGCATEGORY_CLIENT,
2191 NS_LOGMODULE_CLIENT, ISC_LOG_DEBUG(2),
2192 "EDNS client-subnet option: address too short");
2193 return (DNS_R_OPTERR);
2194 }
2195
2196 paddr = (uint8_t *) &caddr.type;
2197 if (addrbytes != 0U) {
2198 memmove(paddr, isc_buffer_current(buf), addrbytes);
2199 isc_buffer_forward(buf, addrbytes);
2200 optlen -= addrbytes;
2201
2202 if ((addrlen % 8) != 0) {
2203 uint8_t bits = ~0U << (8 - (addrlen % 8));
2204 bits &= paddr[addrbytes - 1];
2205 if (bits != paddr[addrbytes - 1])
2206 return (DNS_R_OPTERR);
2207 }
2208 }
2209
2210 memmove(&client->ecs.addr, &caddr, sizeof(caddr));
2211 client->ecs.source = addrlen;
2212 client->ecs.scope = 0;
2213 client->attributes |= NS_CLIENTATTR_HAVEECS;
2214
2215 isc_buffer_forward(buf, (unsigned int)optlen);
2216 return (ISC_R_SUCCESS);
2217}
2218
2219static isc_result_t
2220process_keytag(ns_client_t *client, isc_buffer_t *buf, size_t optlen) {
2221
2222 if (optlen == 0 || (optlen % 2) != 0) {
2223 isc_buffer_forward(buf, (unsigned int)optlen);
2224 return (DNS_R_OPTERR);
2225 }
2226
2227 /* Silently drop additional keytag options. */
2228 if (client->keytag != NULL) {
2229 isc_buffer_forward(buf, (unsigned int)optlen);
2230 return (ISC_R_SUCCESS);
2231 }
2232
2233 client->keytag = isc_mem_get(client->mctx, optlen);
2234 if (client->keytag != NULL) {
2235 client->keytag_len = (uint16_t)optlen;
2236 memmove(client->keytag, isc_buffer_current(buf), optlen);
2237 }
2238 isc_buffer_forward(buf, (unsigned int)optlen);
2239 return (ISC_R_SUCCESS);
2240}
2241
2242static isc_result_t
2243process_opt(ns_client_t *client, dns_rdataset_t *opt) {
2244 dns_rdata_t rdata;
2245 isc_buffer_t optbuf;
2246 isc_result_t result;
2247 uint16_t optcode;
2248 uint16_t optlen;
2249
2250 /*
2251 * Set the client's UDP buffer size.
2252 */
2253 client->udpsize = opt->rdclass;
2254
2255 /*
2256 * If the requested UDP buffer size is less than 512,
2257 * ignore it and use 512.
2258 */
2259 if (client->udpsize < 512)
2260 client->udpsize = 512;
2261
2262 /*
2263 * Get the flags out of the OPT record.
2264 */
2265 client->extflags = (uint16_t)(opt->ttl & 0xFFFF);
2266
2267 /*
2268 * Do we understand this version of EDNS?
2269 *
2270 * XXXRTH need library support for this!
2271 */
2272 client->ednsversion = (opt->ttl & 0x00FF0000) >> 16;
2273 if (client->ednsversion > DNS_EDNS_VERSION) {
2274 ns_stats_increment(client->sctx->nsstats,
2275 ns_statscounter_badednsver);
2276 result = ns_client_addopt(client, client->message,
2277 &client->opt);
2278 if (result == ISC_R_SUCCESS)
2279 result = DNS_R_BADVERS;
2280 ns_client_error(client, result);
2281 return (result);
2282 }
2283
2284 /* Check for NSID request */
2285 result = dns_rdataset_first(opt);
2286 if (result == ISC_R_SUCCESS) {
2287 dns_rdata_init(&rdata);
2288 dns_rdataset_current(opt, &rdata);
2289 isc_buffer_init(&optbuf, rdata.data, rdata.length);
2290 isc_buffer_add(&optbuf, rdata.length);
2291 while (isc_buffer_remaininglength(&optbuf) >= 4) {
2292 optcode = isc_buffer_getuint16(&optbuf);
2293 optlen = isc_buffer_getuint16(&optbuf);
2294 switch (optcode) {
2295 case DNS_OPT_NSID:
2296 if (!WANTNSID(client))
2297 ns_stats_increment(
2298 client->sctx->nsstats,
2299 ns_statscounter_nsidopt);
2300 client->attributes |= NS_CLIENTATTR_WANTNSID;
2301 isc_buffer_forward(&optbuf, optlen);
2302 break;
2303 case DNS_OPT_COOKIE:
2304 process_cookie(client, &optbuf, optlen);
2305 break;
2306 case DNS_OPT_EXPIRE:
2307 if (!WANTEXPIRE(client))
2308 ns_stats_increment(
2309 client->sctx->nsstats,
2310 ns_statscounter_expireopt);
2311 client->attributes |= NS_CLIENTATTR_WANTEXPIRE;
2312 isc_buffer_forward(&optbuf, optlen);
2313 break;
2314 case DNS_OPT_CLIENT_SUBNET:
2315 result = process_ecs(client, &optbuf, optlen);
2316 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS) {
2317 ns_client_error(client, result);
2318 return (result);
2319 }
2320 ns_stats_increment(client->sctx->nsstats,
2321 ns_statscounter_ecsopt);
2322 break;
2323 case DNS_OPT_TCP_KEEPALIVE:
2324 if (!USEKEEPALIVE(client))
2325 ns_stats_increment(
2326 client->sctx->nsstats,
2327 ns_statscounter_keepaliveopt);
2328 client->attributes |=
2329 NS_CLIENTATTR_USEKEEPALIVE;
2330 isc_buffer_forward(&optbuf, optlen);
2331 break;
2332 case DNS_OPT_PAD:
2333 client->attributes |= NS_CLIENTATTR_WANTPAD;
2334 ns_stats_increment(client->sctx->nsstats,
2335 ns_statscounter_padopt);
2336 isc_buffer_forward(&optbuf, optlen);
2337 break;
2338 case DNS_OPT_KEY_TAG:
2339 result = process_keytag(client, &optbuf,
2340 optlen);
2341 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS) {
2342 ns_client_error(client, result);
2343 return (result);
2344 }
2345 ns_stats_increment(client->sctx->nsstats,
2346 ns_statscounter_keytagopt);
2347 break;
2348 default:
2349 ns_stats_increment(client->sctx->nsstats,
2350 ns_statscounter_otheropt);
2351 isc_buffer_forward(&optbuf, optlen);
2352 break;
2353 }
2354 }
2355 }
2356
2357 ns_stats_increment(client->sctx->nsstats, ns_statscounter_edns0in);
2358 client->attributes |= NS_CLIENTATTR_WANTOPT;
2359
2360 return (result);
2361}
2362
2363/*
2364 * Handle an incoming request event from the socket (UDP case)
2365 * or tcpmsg (TCP case).
2366 */
2367void
2368ns__client_request(isc_task_t *task, isc_event_t *event) {
2369 ns_client_t *client;
2370 isc_socketevent_t *sevent;
2371 isc_result_t result;
2372 isc_result_t sigresult = ISC_R_SUCCESS;
2373 isc_buffer_t *buffer;
2374 isc_buffer_t tbuffer;
2375 dns_rdataset_t *opt;
2376 const dns_name_t *signame;
2377 bool ra; /* Recursion available. */
2378 isc_netaddr_t netaddr;
2379 int match;
2380 dns_messageid_t id;
2381 unsigned int flags;
2382 bool notimp;
2383 size_t reqsize;
2384 dns_aclenv_t *env;
2385#ifdef HAVE_DNSTAP
2386 dns_dtmsgtype_t dtmsgtype;
2387#endif
2388
2389 REQUIRE(event != NULL);
2390 client = event->ev_arg;
2391 REQUIRE(NS_CLIENT_VALID(client));
2392 REQUIRE(task == client->task);
2393
2394 INSIST(client->recursionquota == NULL);
2395
2396 INSIST(client->state == (TCP_CLIENT(client) ?
2397 NS_CLIENTSTATE_READING :
2398 NS_CLIENTSTATE_READY));
2399
2400 ns_client_requests++;
2401
2402 if (event->ev_type == ISC_SOCKEVENT_RECVDONE) {
2403 INSIST(!TCP_CLIENT(client));
2404 sevent = (isc_socketevent_t *)event;
2405 REQUIRE(sevent == client->recvevent);
2406 isc_buffer_init(&tbuffer, sevent->region.base, sevent->n);
2407 isc_buffer_add(&tbuffer, sevent->n);
2408 buffer = &tbuffer;
2409 result = sevent->result;
2410 if (result == ISC_R_SUCCESS) {
2411 client->peeraddr = sevent->address;
2412 client->peeraddr_valid = true;
2413 }
2414 if ((sevent->attributes & ISC_SOCKEVENTATTR_DSCP) != 0) {
2415 ns_client_log(client, NS_LOGCATEGORY_CLIENT,
2416 NS_LOGMODULE_CLIENT, ISC_LOG_DEBUG(90),
2417 "received DSCP %d", sevent->dscp);
2418 if (client->dscp == -1)
2419 client->dscp = sevent->dscp;
2420 }
2421 if ((sevent->attributes & ISC_SOCKEVENTATTR_PKTINFO) != 0) {
2422 client->attributes |= NS_CLIENTATTR_PKTINFO;
2423 client->pktinfo = sevent->pktinfo;
2424 }
2425 if ((sevent->attributes & ISC_SOCKEVENTATTR_MULTICAST) != 0)
2426 client->attributes |= NS_CLIENTATTR_MULTICAST;
2427 client->nrecvs--;
2428 } else {
2429 INSIST(TCP_CLIENT(client));
2430 INSIST(client->tcpconn != NULL);
2431 REQUIRE(event->ev_type == DNS_EVENT_TCPMSG);
2432 REQUIRE(event->ev_sender == &client->tcpmsg);
2433 buffer = &client->tcpmsg.buffer;
2434 result = client->tcpmsg.result;
2435 INSIST(client->nreads == 1);
2436 /*
2437 * client->peeraddr was set when the connection was accepted.
2438 */
2439 client->nreads--;
2440 }
2441
2442 reqsize = isc_buffer_usedlength(buffer);
2443 /* don't count the length header */
2444 if (TCP_CLIENT(client))
2445 reqsize -= 2;
2446
2447 if (exit_check(client)) {
2448 return;
2449 }
2450 client->state = client->newstate = NS_CLIENTSTATE_WORKING;
2451
2452 isc_task_getcurrenttimex(task, &client->requesttime);
2453 client->tnow = client->requesttime;
2454 client->now = isc_time_seconds(&client->tnow);
2455
2456 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS) {
2457 if (TCP_CLIENT(client)) {
2458 ns_client_next(client, result);
2459 } else {
2460 if (result != ISC_R_CANCELED)
2461 isc_log_write(ns_lctx, NS_LOGCATEGORY_CLIENT,
2462 NS_LOGMODULE_CLIENT,
2463 ISC_LOG_ERROR,
2464 "UDP client handler shutting "
2465 "down due to fatal receive "
2466 "error: %s",
2467 isc_result_totext(result));
2468 isc_task_shutdown(client->task);
2469 }
2470 return;
2471 }
2472
2473 isc_netaddr_fromsockaddr(&netaddr, &client->peeraddr);
2474
2475#if NS_CLIENT_DROPPORT
2476 if (ns_client_dropport(isc_sockaddr_getport(&client->peeraddr)) ==
2477 DROPPORT_REQUEST) {
2478 ns_client_log(client, DNS_LOGCATEGORY_SECURITY,
2479 NS_LOGMODULE_CLIENT, ISC_LOG_DEBUG(10),
2480 "dropped request: suspicious port");
2481 ns_client_next(client, ISC_R_SUCCESS);
2482 return;
2483 }
2484#endif
2485
2486 ns_client_log(client, NS_LOGCATEGORY_CLIENT,
2487 NS_LOGMODULE_CLIENT, ISC_LOG_DEBUG(3),
2488 "%s request",
2489 TCP_CLIENT(client) ? "TCP" : "UDP");
2490
2491 /*
2492 * Check the blackhole ACL for UDP only, since TCP is done in
2493 * client_newconn.
2494 */
2495 env = ns_interfacemgr_getaclenv(client->interface->mgr);
2496 if (!TCP_CLIENT(client)) {
2497 if (client->sctx->blackholeacl != NULL &&
2498 (dns_acl_match(&netaddr, NULL, client->sctx->blackholeacl,
2499 env, &match, NULL) == ISC_R_SUCCESS) &&
2500 match > 0)
2501 {
2502 ns_client_log(client, DNS_LOGCATEGORY_SECURITY,
2503 NS_LOGMODULE_CLIENT, ISC_LOG_DEBUG(10),
2504 "blackholed UDP datagram");
2505 ns_client_next(client, ISC_R_SUCCESS);
2506 return;
2507 }
2508 }
2509
2510 /*
2511 * Silently drop multicast requests for the present.
2512 * XXXMPA revisit this as mDNS spec was published.
2513 */
2514 if ((client->attributes & NS_CLIENTATTR_MULTICAST) != 0) {
2515 ns_client_log(client, NS_LOGCATEGORY_CLIENT,
2516 NS_LOGMODULE_CLIENT, ISC_LOG_DEBUG(2),
2517 "dropping multicast request");
2518 ns_client_next(client, DNS_R_REFUSED);
2519 return;
2520 }
2521
2522 result = dns_message_peekheader(buffer, &id, &flags);
2523 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS) {
2524 /*
2525 * There isn't enough header to determine whether
2526 * this was a request or a response. Drop it.
2527 */
2528 ns_client_next(client, result);
2529 return;
2530 }
2531
2532 /*
2533 * The client object handles requests, not responses.
2534 * If this is a UDP response, forward it to the dispatcher.
2535 * If it's a TCP response, discard it here.
2536 */
2537 if ((flags & DNS_MESSAGEFLAG_QR) != 0) {
2538 if (TCP_CLIENT(client)) {
2539 CTRACE("unexpected response");
2540 ns_client_next(client, DNS_R_FORMERR);
2541 return;
2542 } else {
2543 dns_dispatch_importrecv(client->dispatch, event);
2544 ns_client_next(client, ISC_R_SUCCESS);
2545 return;
2546 }
2547 }
2548
2549 /*
2550 * Update some statistics counters. Don't count responses.
2551 */
2552 if (isc_sockaddr_pf(&client->peeraddr) == PF_INET) {
2553 ns_stats_increment(client->sctx->nsstats,
2554 ns_statscounter_requestv4);
2555 } else {
2556 ns_stats_increment(client->sctx->nsstats,
2557 ns_statscounter_requestv6);
2558 }
2559 if (TCP_CLIENT(client)) {
2560 ns_stats_increment(client->sctx->nsstats,
2561 ns_statscounter_requesttcp);
2562 switch (isc_sockaddr_pf(&client->peeraddr)) {
2563 case AF_INET:
2564 isc_stats_increment(client->sctx->tcpinstats4,
2565 ISC_MIN((int)reqsize / 16, 18));
2566 break;
2567 case AF_INET6:
2568 isc_stats_increment(client->sctx->tcpinstats6,
2569 ISC_MIN((int)reqsize / 16, 18));
2570 break;
2571 default:
2572 INSIST(0);
2573 ISC_UNREACHABLE();
2574 }
2575 } else {
2576 switch (isc_sockaddr_pf(&client->peeraddr)) {
2577 case AF_INET:
2578 isc_stats_increment(client->sctx->udpinstats4,
2579 ISC_MIN((int)reqsize / 16, 18));
2580 break;
2581 case AF_INET6:
2582 isc_stats_increment(client->sctx->udpinstats6,
2583 ISC_MIN((int)reqsize / 16, 18));
2584 break;
2585 default:
2586 INSIST(0);
2587 ISC_UNREACHABLE();
2588 }
2589 }
2590
2591 /*
2592 * It's a request. Parse it.
2593 */
2594 result = dns_message_parse(client->message, buffer, 0);
2595 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS) {
2596 /*
2597 * Parsing the request failed. Send a response
2598 * (typically FORMERR or SERVFAIL).
2599 */
2600 if (result == DNS_R_OPTERR) {
2601 (void)ns_client_addopt(client, client->message,
2602 &client->opt);
2603 }
2604
2605 ns_client_log(client, NS_LOGCATEGORY_CLIENT,
2606 NS_LOGMODULE_CLIENT, ISC_LOG_DEBUG(1),
2607 "message parsing failed: %s",
2608 isc_result_totext(result));
2609 if (result == ISC_R_NOSPACE) {
2610 result = DNS_R_FORMERR;
2611 }
2612 ns_client_error(client, result);
2613 return;
2614 }
2615
2616 /*
2617 * Pipeline TCP query processing.
2618 */
2619 if (TCP_CLIENT(client) &&
2620 client->message->opcode != dns_opcode_query)
2621 {
2622 client->tcpconn->pipelined = false;
2623 }
2624 if (TCP_CLIENT(client) && client->tcpconn->pipelined) {
2625 /*
2626 * We're pipelining. Replace the client; the
2627 * replacement can read the TCP socket looking
2628 * for new messages and this one can process the
2629 * current message asynchronously.
2630 *
2631 * There will now be at least three clients using this
2632 * TCP socket - one accepting new connections,
2633 * one reading an existing connection to get new
2634 * messages, and one answering the message already
2635 * received.
2636 */
2637 result = ns_client_replace(client);
2638 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS) {
2639 client->tcpconn->pipelined = false;
2640 }
2641 }
2642
2643 dns_opcodestats_increment(client->sctx->opcodestats,
2644 client->message->opcode);
2645 switch (client->message->opcode) {
2646 case dns_opcode_query:
2647 case dns_opcode_update:
2648 case dns_opcode_notify:
2649 notimp = false;
2650 break;
2651 case dns_opcode_iquery:
2652 default:
2653 notimp = true;
2654 break;
2655 }
2656
2657 client->message->rcode = dns_rcode_noerror;
2658
2659 /* RFC1123 section 6.1.3.2 */
2660 if ((client->attributes & NS_CLIENTATTR_MULTICAST) != 0)
2661 client->message->flags &= ~DNS_MESSAGEFLAG_RD;
2662
2663 /*
2664 * Deal with EDNS.
2665 */
2666 if ((client->sctx->options & NS_SERVER_NOEDNS) != 0)
2667 opt = NULL;
2668 else
2669 opt = dns_message_getopt(client->message);
2670
2671 client->ecs.source = 0;
2672 client->ecs.scope = 0;
2673
2674 if (opt != NULL) {
2675 /*
2676 * Are returning FORMERR to all EDNS queries?
2677 * Simulate a STD13 compliant server.
2678 */
2679 if ((client->sctx->options & NS_SERVER_EDNSFORMERR) != 0) {
2680 ns_client_error(client, DNS_R_FORMERR);
2681 return;
2682 }
2683
2684 /*
2685 * Are returning NOTIMP to all EDNS queries?
2686 */
2687 if ((client->sctx->options & NS_SERVER_EDNSNOTIMP) != 0) {
2688 ns_client_error(client, DNS_R_NOTIMP);
2689 return;
2690 }
2691
2692 /*
2693 * Are returning REFUSED to all EDNS queries?
2694 */
2695 if ((client->sctx->options & NS_SERVER_EDNSREFUSED) != 0) {
2696 ns_client_error(client, DNS_R_REFUSED);
2697 return;
2698 }
2699
2700 /*
2701 * Are we dropping all EDNS queries?
2702 */
2703 if ((client->sctx->options & NS_SERVER_DROPEDNS) != 0) {
2704 ns_client_next(client, ISC_R_SUCCESS);
2705 return;
2706 }
2707
2708 result = process_opt(client, opt);
2709 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS)
2710 return;
2711 }
2712
2713 if (client->message->rdclass == 0) {
2714 if ((client->attributes & NS_CLIENTATTR_WANTCOOKIE) != 0 &&
2715 client->message->opcode == dns_opcode_query &&
2716 client->message->counts[DNS_SECTION_QUESTION] == 0U)
2717 {
2718 result = dns_message_reply(client->message, true);
2719 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS) {
2720 ns_client_error(client, result);
2721 return;
2722 }
2723 if (notimp)
2724 client->message->rcode = dns_rcode_notimp;
2725 ns_client_send(client);
2726 return;
2727 }
2728 ns_client_log(client, NS_LOGCATEGORY_CLIENT,
2729 NS_LOGMODULE_CLIENT, ISC_LOG_DEBUG(1),
2730 "message class could not be determined");
2731 ns_client_dumpmessage(client,
2732 "message class could not be determined");
2733 ns_client_error(client, notimp ? DNS_R_NOTIMP : DNS_R_FORMERR);
2734 return;
2735 }
2736
2737 /*
2738 * Determine the destination address. If the receiving interface is
2739 * bound to a specific address, we simply use it regardless of the
2740 * address family. All IPv4 queries should fall into this case.
2741 * Otherwise, if this is a TCP query, get the address from the
2742 * receiving socket (this needs a system call and can be heavy).
2743 * For IPv6 UDP queries, we get this from the pktinfo structure (if
2744 * supported).
2745 * If all the attempts fail (this can happen due to memory shortage,
2746 * etc), we regard this as an error for safety.
2747 */
2748 if ((client->interface->flags & NS_INTERFACEFLAG_ANYADDR) == 0)
2749 isc_netaddr_fromsockaddr(&client->destaddr,
2750 &client->interface->addr);
2751 else {
2752 isc_sockaddr_t sockaddr;
2753 result = ISC_R_FAILURE;
2754
2755 if (TCP_CLIENT(client))
2756 result = isc_socket_getsockname(client->tcpsocket,
2757 &sockaddr);
2758 if (result == ISC_R_SUCCESS)
2759 isc_netaddr_fromsockaddr(&client->destaddr, &sockaddr);
2760 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS &&
2761 client->interface->addr.type.sa.sa_family == AF_INET6 &&
2762 (client->attributes & NS_CLIENTATTR_PKTINFO) != 0) {
2763 /*
2764 * XXXJT technically, we should convert the receiving
2765 * interface ID to a proper scope zone ID. However,
2766 * due to the fact there is no standard API for this,
2767 * we only handle link-local addresses and use the
2768 * interface index as link ID. Despite the assumption,
2769 * it should cover most typical cases.
2770 */
