2771 isc_netaddr_fromin6(&client->destaddr,
2772 &client->pktinfo.ipi6_addr);
2773 if (IN6_IS_ADDR_LINKLOCAL(&client->pktinfo.ipi6_addr))
2774 isc_netaddr_setzone(&client->destaddr,
2775 client->pktinfo.ipi6_ifindex);
2776 result = ISC_R_SUCCESS;
2777 }
2778 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS) {
2779 UNEXPECTED_ERROR(__FILE__, __LINE__,
2780 "failed to get request's "
2781 "destination: %s",
2782 isc_result_totext(result));
2783 ns_client_next(client, ISC_R_SUCCESS);
2784 return;
2785 }
2786 }
2787
2788 isc_sockaddr_fromnetaddr(&client->destsockaddr, &client->destaddr, 0);
2789
2790 result = client->sctx->matchingview(&netaddr, &client->destaddr,
2791 client->message, env,
2792 &sigresult, &client->view);
2793 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS) {
2794 char classname[DNS_RDATACLASS_FORMATSIZE];
2795
2796 /*
2797 * Do a dummy TSIG verification attempt so that the
2798 * response will have a TSIG if the query did, as
2799 * required by RFC2845.
2800 */
2801 isc_buffer_t b;
2802 isc_region_t *r;
2803
2804 dns_message_resetsig(client->message);
2805
2806 r = dns_message_getrawmessage(client->message);
2807 isc_buffer_init(&b, r->base, r->length);
2808 isc_buffer_add(&b, r->length);
2809 (void)dns_tsig_verify(&b, client->message, NULL, NULL);
2810
2811 dns_rdataclass_format(client->message->rdclass, classname,
2812 sizeof(classname));
2813 ns_client_log(client, NS_LOGCATEGORY_CLIENT,
2814 NS_LOGMODULE_CLIENT, ISC_LOG_DEBUG(1),
2815 "no matching view in class '%s'", classname);
2816 ns_client_dumpmessage(client, "no matching view in class");
2817 ns_client_error(client, notimp ? DNS_R_NOTIMP : DNS_R_REFUSED);
2818 return;
2819 }
2820
2821 ns_client_log(client, NS_LOGCATEGORY_CLIENT,
2822 NS_LOGMODULE_CLIENT, ISC_LOG_DEBUG(5),
2823 "using view '%s'", client->view->name);
2824
2825 /*
2826 * Check for a signature. We log bad signatures regardless of
2827 * whether they ultimately cause the request to be rejected or
2828 * not. We do not log the lack of a signature unless we are
2829 * debugging.
2830 */
2831 client->signer = NULL;
2832 dns_name_init(&client->signername, NULL);
2833 result = dns_message_signer(client->message, &client->signername);
2834 if (result != ISC_R_NOTFOUND) {
2835 signame = NULL;
2836 if (dns_message_gettsig(client->message, &signame) != NULL) {
2837 ns_stats_increment(client->sctx->nsstats,
2838 ns_statscounter_tsigin);
2839 } else {
2840 ns_stats_increment(client->sctx->nsstats,
2841 ns_statscounter_sig0in);
2842 }
2843
2844 }
2845 if (result == ISC_R_SUCCESS) {
2846 char namebuf[DNS_NAME_FORMATSIZE];
2847 dns_name_format(&client->signername, namebuf, sizeof(namebuf));
2848 ns_client_log(client, DNS_LOGCATEGORY_SECURITY,
2849 NS_LOGMODULE_CLIENT, ISC_LOG_DEBUG(3),
2850 "request has valid signature: %s", namebuf);
2851 client->signer = &client->signername;
2852 } else if (result == ISC_R_NOTFOUND) {
2853 ns_client_log(client, DNS_LOGCATEGORY_SECURITY,
2854 NS_LOGMODULE_CLIENT, ISC_LOG_DEBUG(3),
2855 "request is not signed");
2856 } else if (result == DNS_R_NOIDENTITY) {
2857 ns_client_log(client, DNS_LOGCATEGORY_SECURITY,
2858 NS_LOGMODULE_CLIENT, ISC_LOG_DEBUG(3),
2859 "request is signed by a nonauthoritative key");
2860 } else {
2861 char tsigrcode[64];
2862 isc_buffer_t b;
2863 dns_rcode_t status;
2864 isc_result_t tresult;
2865
2866 /* There is a signature, but it is bad. */
2867 ns_stats_increment(client->sctx->nsstats,
2868 ns_statscounter_invalidsig);
2869 signame = NULL;
2870 if (dns_message_gettsig(client->message, &signame) != NULL) {
2871 char namebuf[DNS_NAME_FORMATSIZE];
2872 char cnamebuf[DNS_NAME_FORMATSIZE];
2873 dns_name_format(signame, namebuf, sizeof(namebuf));
2874 status = client->message->tsigstatus;
2875 isc_buffer_init(&b, tsigrcode, sizeof(tsigrcode) - 1);
2876 tresult = dns_tsigrcode_totext(status, &b);
2877 INSIST(tresult == ISC_R_SUCCESS);
2878 tsigrcode[isc_buffer_usedlength(&b)] = '\0';
2879 if (client->message->tsigkey->generated) {
2880 dns_name_format(client->message->tsigkey->creator,
2881 cnamebuf, sizeof(cnamebuf));
2882 ns_client_log(client, DNS_LOGCATEGORY_SECURITY,
2883 NS_LOGMODULE_CLIENT,
2884 ISC_LOG_ERROR,
2885 "request has invalid signature: "
2886 "TSIG %s (%s): %s (%s)", namebuf,
2887 cnamebuf,
2888 isc_result_totext(result),
2889 tsigrcode);
2890 } else {
2891 ns_client_log(client, DNS_LOGCATEGORY_SECURITY,
2892 NS_LOGMODULE_CLIENT,
2893 ISC_LOG_ERROR,
2894 "request has invalid signature: "
2895 "TSIG %s: %s (%s)", namebuf,
2896 isc_result_totext(result),
2897 tsigrcode);
2898 }
2899 } else {
2900 status = client->message->sig0status;
2901 isc_buffer_init(&b, tsigrcode, sizeof(tsigrcode) - 1);
2902 tresult = dns_tsigrcode_totext(status, &b);
2903 INSIST(tresult == ISC_R_SUCCESS);
2904 tsigrcode[isc_buffer_usedlength(&b)] = '\0';
2905 ns_client_log(client, DNS_LOGCATEGORY_SECURITY,
2906 NS_LOGMODULE_CLIENT, ISC_LOG_ERROR,
2907 "request has invalid signature: %s (%s)",
2908 isc_result_totext(result), tsigrcode);
2909 }
2910 /*
2911 * Accept update messages signed by unknown keys so that
2912 * update forwarding works transparently through slaves
2913 * that don't have all the same keys as the master.
2914 */
2915 if (!(client->message->tsigstatus == dns_tsigerror_badkey &&
2916 client->message->opcode == dns_opcode_update)) {
2917 ns_client_error(client, sigresult);
2918 return;
2919 }
2920 }
2921
2922 /*
2923 * Decide whether recursive service is available to this client.
2924 * We do this here rather than in the query code so that we can
2925 * set the RA bit correctly on all kinds of responses, not just
2926 * responses to ordinary queries. Note if you can't query the
2927 * cache there is no point in setting RA.
2928 */
2929 ra = false;
2930 if (client->view->resolver != NULL &&
2931 client->view->recursion == true &&
2932 ns_client_checkaclsilent(client, NULL,
2933 client->view->recursionacl,
2934 true) == ISC_R_SUCCESS &&
2935 ns_client_checkaclsilent(client, NULL,
2936 client->view->cacheacl,
2937 true) == ISC_R_SUCCESS &&
2938 ns_client_checkaclsilent(client, &client->destaddr,
2939 client->view->recursiononacl,
2940 true) == ISC_R_SUCCESS &&
2941 ns_client_checkaclsilent(client, &client->destaddr,
2942 client->view->cacheonacl,
2943 true) == ISC_R_SUCCESS)
2944 ra = true;
2945
2946 if (ra == true)
2947 client->attributes |= NS_CLIENTATTR_RA;
2948
2949 ns_client_log(client, DNS_LOGCATEGORY_SECURITY, NS_LOGMODULE_CLIENT,
2950 ISC_LOG_DEBUG(3), ra ? "recursion available" :
2951 "recursion not available");
2952
2953 /*
2954 * Adjust maximum UDP response size for this client.
2955 */
2956 if (client->udpsize > 512) {
2957 dns_peer_t *peer = NULL;
2958 uint16_t udpsize = client->view->maxudp;
2959 (void) dns_peerlist_peerbyaddr(client->view->peers,
2960 &netaddr, &peer);
2961 if (peer != NULL)
2962 dns_peer_getmaxudp(peer, &udpsize);
2963 if (client->udpsize > udpsize)
2964 client->udpsize = udpsize;
2965 }
2966
2967 /*
2968 * Dispatch the request.
2969 */
2970 switch (client->message->opcode) {
2971 case dns_opcode_query:
2972 CTRACE("query");
2973#ifdef HAVE_DNSTAP
2974 if ((client->message->flags & DNS_MESSAGEFLAG_RD) != 0)
2975 dtmsgtype = DNS_DTTYPE_CQ;
2976 else
2977 dtmsgtype = DNS_DTTYPE_AQ;
2978
2979 dns_dt_send(client->view, dtmsgtype, &client->peeraddr,
2980 &client->destsockaddr, TCP_CLIENT(client), NULL,
2981 &client->requesttime, NULL, buffer);
2982#endif /* HAVE_DNSTAP */
2983
2984 ns_query_start(client);
2985 break;
2986 case dns_opcode_update:
2987 CTRACE("update");
2988#ifdef HAVE_DNSTAP
2989 dns_dt_send(client->view, DNS_DTTYPE_UQ, &client->peeraddr,
2990 &client->destsockaddr, TCP_CLIENT(client), NULL,
2991 &client->requesttime, NULL, buffer);
2992#endif /* HAVE_DNSTAP */
2993 ns_client_settimeout(client, 60);
2994 ns_update_start(client, sigresult);
2995 break;
2996 case dns_opcode_notify:
2997 CTRACE("notify");
2998 ns_client_settimeout(client, 60);
2999 ns_notify_start(client);
3000 break;
3001 case dns_opcode_iquery:
3002 CTRACE("iquery");
3003 ns_client_error(client, DNS_R_NOTIMP);
3004 break;
3005 default:
3006 CTRACE("unknown opcode");
3007 ns_client_error(client, DNS_R_NOTIMP);
3008 }
3009}
3010
3011static void
3012client_timeout(isc_task_t *task, isc_event_t *event) {
3013 ns_client_t *client;
3014
3015 REQUIRE(event != NULL);
3016 REQUIRE(event->ev_type == ISC_TIMEREVENT_LIFE ||
3017 event->ev_type == ISC_TIMEREVENT_IDLE);
3018 client = event->ev_arg;
3019 REQUIRE(NS_CLIENT_VALID(client));
3020 REQUIRE(task == client->task);
3021 REQUIRE(client->timer != NULL);
3022
3023 UNUSED(task);
3024
3025 CTRACE("timeout");
3026
3027 isc_event_free(&event);
3028
3029 if (client->shutdown != NULL) {
3030 (client->shutdown)(client->shutdown_arg, ISC_R_TIMEDOUT);
3031 client->shutdown = NULL;
3032 client->shutdown_arg = NULL;
3033 }
3034
3035 if (client->newstate > NS_CLIENTSTATE_READY)
3036 client->newstate = NS_CLIENTSTATE_READY;
3037 (void)exit_check(client);
3038}
3039
3040static isc_result_t
3041get_clientmctx(ns_clientmgr_t *manager, isc_mem_t **mctxp) {
3042 isc_mem_t *clientmctx;
3043 isc_result_t result;
3044#if NMCTXS > 0
3045 unsigned int nextmctx;
3046#endif
3047
3048 MTRACE("clientmctx");
3049
3050 /*
3051 * Caller must be holding the manager lock.
3052 */
3053 if ((manager->sctx->options & NS_SERVER_CLIENTTEST) != 0) {
3054 result = isc_mem_create(0, 0, mctxp);
3055 if (result == ISC_R_SUCCESS)
3056 isc_mem_setname(*mctxp, "client", NULL);
3057 return (result);
3058 }
3059#if NMCTXS > 0
3060 nextmctx = manager->nextmctx++;
3061 if (manager->nextmctx == NMCTXS)
3062 manager->nextmctx = 0;
3063
3064 INSIST(nextmctx < NMCTXS);
3065
3066 clientmctx = manager->mctxpool[nextmctx];
3067 if (clientmctx == NULL) {
3068 result = isc_mem_create(0, 0, &clientmctx);
3069 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS)
3070 return (result);
3071 isc_mem_setname(clientmctx, "client", NULL);
3072
3073 manager->mctxpool[nextmctx] = clientmctx;
3074 }
3075#else
3076 clientmctx = manager->mctx;
3077#endif
3078
3079 isc_mem_attach(clientmctx, mctxp);
3080
3081 return (ISC_R_SUCCESS);
3082}
3083
3084static isc_result_t
3085client_create(ns_clientmgr_t *manager, ns_client_t **clientp) {
3086 ns_client_t *client;
3087 isc_result_t result;
3088 isc_mem_t *mctx = NULL;
3089
3090 /*
3091 * Caller must be holding the manager lock.
3092 *
3093 * Note: creating a client does not add the client to the
3094 * manager's client list or set the client's manager pointer.
3095 * The caller is responsible for that.
3096 */
3097
3098 REQUIRE(clientp != NULL && *clientp == NULL);
3099
3100 result = get_clientmctx(manager, &mctx);
3101 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS)
3102 return (result);
3103
3104 client = isc_mem_get(mctx, sizeof(*client));
3105 if (client == NULL) {
3106 isc_mem_detach(&mctx);
3107 return (ISC_R_NOMEMORY);
3108 }
3109 client->mctx = mctx;
3110
3111 client->sctx = NULL;
3112 ns_server_attach(manager->sctx, &client->sctx);
3113
3114 client->task = NULL;
3115 result = isc_task_create(manager->taskmgr, 0, &client->task);
3116 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS)
3117 goto cleanup_client;
3118 isc_task_setname(client->task, "client", client);
3119
3120 client->timer = NULL;
3121 result = isc_timer_create(manager->timermgr, isc_timertype_inactive,
3122 NULL, NULL, client->task, client_timeout,
3123 client, &client->timer);
3124 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS)
3125 goto cleanup_task;
3126 client->timerset = false;
3127
3128 client->delaytimer = NULL;
3129
3130 client->message = NULL;
3131 result = dns_message_create(client->mctx, DNS_MESSAGE_INTENTPARSE,
3132 &client->message);
3133 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS)
3134 goto cleanup_timer;
3135
3136 /* XXXRTH Hardwired constants */
3137
3138 client->sendevent = isc_socket_socketevent(client->mctx, client,
3139 ISC_SOCKEVENT_SENDDONE,
3140 client_senddone, client);
3141 if (client->sendevent == NULL) {
3142 result = ISC_R_NOMEMORY;
3143 goto cleanup_message;
3144 }
3145
3146 client->recvbuf = isc_mem_get(client->mctx, RECV_BUFFER_SIZE);
3147 if (client->recvbuf == NULL) {
3148 result = ISC_R_NOMEMORY;
3149 goto cleanup_sendevent;
3150 }
3151
3152 client->recvevent = isc_socket_socketevent(client->mctx, client,
3153 ISC_SOCKEVENT_RECVDONE,
3154 ns__client_request, client);
3155 if (client->recvevent == NULL) {
3156 result = ISC_R_NOMEMORY;
3157 goto cleanup_recvbuf;
3158 }
3159
3160 client->magic = NS_CLIENT_MAGIC;
3161 client->manager = NULL;
3162 client->state = NS_CLIENTSTATE_INACTIVE;
3163 client->newstate = NS_CLIENTSTATE_MAX;
3164 client->naccepts = 0;
3165 client->nreads = 0;
3166 client->nsends = 0;
3167 client->nrecvs = 0;
3168 client->nupdates = 0;
3169 client->nctls = 0;
3170 client->references = 0;
3171 client->attributes = 0;
3172 client->view = NULL;
3173 client->dispatch = NULL;
3174 client->udpsocket = NULL;
3175 client->tcplistener = NULL;
3176 client->tcpsocket = NULL;
3177 client->tcpmsg_valid = false;
3178 client->tcpbuf = NULL;
3179 client->opt = NULL;
3180 client->udpsize = 512;
3181 client->dscp = -1;
3182 client->extflags = 0;
3183 client->ednsversion = -1;
3184 client->next = NULL;
3185 client->shutdown = NULL;
3186 client->shutdown_arg = NULL;
3187 client->signer = NULL;
3188 dns_name_init(&client->signername, NULL);
3189 client->mortal = false;
3190 client->sendcb = NULL;
3191 client->tcpconn = NULL;
3192 client->recursionquota = NULL;
3193 client->interface = NULL;
3194 client->peeraddr_valid = false;
3195 dns_ecs_init(&client->ecs);
3196 client->needshutdown = ((client->sctx->options &
3197 NS_SERVER_CLIENTTEST) != 0);
3198 client->tcpactive = false;
3199
3200 ISC_EVENT_INIT(&client->ctlevent, sizeof(client->ctlevent), 0, NULL,
3201 NS_EVENT_CLIENTCONTROL, client_start, client, client,
3202 NULL, NULL);
3203 /*
3204 * Initialize FORMERR cache to sentinel value that will not match
3205 * any actual FORMERR response.
3206 */
3207 isc_sockaddr_any(&client->formerrcache.addr);
3208 client->formerrcache.time = 0;
3209 client->formerrcache.id = 0;
3210 ISC_LINK_INIT(client, link);
3211 ISC_LINK_INIT(client, rlink);
3212 ISC_QLINK_INIT(client, ilink);
3213 client->keytag = NULL;
3214 client->keytag_len = 0;
3215
3216 /*
3217 * We call the init routines for the various kinds of client here,
3218 * after we have created an otherwise valid client, because some
3219 * of them call routines that REQUIRE(NS_CLIENT_VALID(client)).
3220 */
3221 result = ns_query_init(client);
3222 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS)
3223 goto cleanup_recvevent;
3224
3225 result = isc_task_onshutdown(client->task, client_shutdown, client);
3226 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS)
3227 goto cleanup_query;
3228
3229 CTRACE("create");
3230
3231 *clientp = client;
3232
3233 return (ISC_R_SUCCESS);
3234
3235 cleanup_query:
3236 ns_query_free(client);
3237
3238 cleanup_recvevent:
3239 isc_event_free((isc_event_t **)&client->recvevent);
3240
3241 cleanup_recvbuf:
3242 isc_mem_put(client->mctx, client->recvbuf, RECV_BUFFER_SIZE);
3243
3244 cleanup_sendevent:
3245 isc_event_free((isc_event_t **)&client->sendevent);
3246
3247 client->magic = 0;
3248
3249 cleanup_message:
3250 dns_message_destroy(&client->message);
3251
3252 cleanup_timer:
3253 isc_timer_detach(&client->timer);
3254
3255 cleanup_task:
3256 isc_task_detach(&client->task);
3257
3258 cleanup_client:
3259 if (client->sctx != NULL)
3260 ns_server_detach(&client->sctx);
3261 isc_mem_putanddetach(&client->mctx, client, sizeof(*client));
3262
3263 return (result);
3264}
3265
3266static void
3267client_read(ns_client_t *client, bool newconn) {
3268 isc_result_t result;
3269
3270 CTRACE("read");
3271
3272 result = dns_tcpmsg_readmessage(&client->tcpmsg, client->task,
3273 ns__client_request, client);
3274 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS)
3275 goto fail;
3276
3277 /*
3278 * Set a timeout to limit the amount of time we will wait
3279 * for a request on this TCP connection.
3280 */
3281 read_settimeout(client, newconn);
3282
3283 client->state = client->newstate = NS_CLIENTSTATE_READING;
3284 INSIST(client->nreads == 0);
3285 INSIST(client->recursionquota == NULL);
3286 client->nreads++;
3287
3288 return;
3289 fail:
3290 ns_client_next(client, result);
3291}
3292
3293static void
3294client_newconn(isc_task_t *task, isc_event_t *event) {
3295 isc_result_t result;
3296 ns_client_t *client = event->ev_arg;
3297 isc_socket_newconnev_t *nevent = (isc_socket_newconnev_t *)event;
3298 dns_aclenv_t *env = ns_interfacemgr_getaclenv(client->interface->mgr);
3299 uint32_t old;
3300
3301 REQUIRE(event->ev_type == ISC_SOCKEVENT_NEWCONN);
3302 REQUIRE(NS_CLIENT_VALID(client));
3303 REQUIRE(client->task == task);
3304
3305 UNUSED(task);
3306
3307 INSIST(client->state == NS_CLIENTSTATE_READY);
3308
3309 /*
3310 * The accept() was successful and we're now establishing a new
3311 * connection. We need to make note of it in the client and
3312 * interface objects so client objects can do the right thing
3313 * when going inactive in exit_check() (see comments in
3314 * client_accept() for details).
3315 */
3316 INSIST(client->naccepts == 1);
3317 client->naccepts--;
3318
3319 old = atomic_fetch_sub(&client->interface->ntcpaccepting, 1);
3320 INSIST(old > 0);
3321
3322 /*
3323 * We must take ownership of the new socket before the exit
3324 * check to make sure it gets destroyed if we decide to exit.
3325 */
3326 if (nevent->result == ISC_R_SUCCESS) {
3327 client->tcpsocket = nevent->newsocket;
3328 isc_socket_setname(client->tcpsocket, "client-tcp", NULL);
3329 client->state = NS_CLIENTSTATE_READING;
3330 INSIST(client->recursionquota == NULL);
3331
3332 (void)isc_socket_getpeername(client->tcpsocket,
3333 &client->peeraddr);
3334 client->peeraddr_valid = true;
3335 ns_client_log(client, NS_LOGCATEGORY_CLIENT,
3336 NS_LOGMODULE_CLIENT, ISC_LOG_DEBUG(3),
3337 "new TCP connection");
3338 } else {
3339 /*
3340 * XXXRTH What should we do? We're trying to accept but
3341 * it didn't work. If we just give up, then TCP
3342 * service may eventually stop.
3343 *
3344 * For now, we just go idle.
3345 *
3346 * Going idle is probably the right thing if the
3347 * I/O was canceled.
3348 */
3349 ns_client_log(client, NS_LOGCATEGORY_CLIENT,
3350 NS_LOGMODULE_CLIENT, ISC_LOG_DEBUG(3),
3351 "accept failed: %s",
3352 isc_result_totext(nevent->result));
3353 tcpconn_detach(client);
3354 }
3355
3356 if (exit_check(client))
3357 goto freeevent;
3358
3359 if (nevent->result == ISC_R_SUCCESS) {
3360 int match;
3361 isc_netaddr_t netaddr;
3362
3363 isc_netaddr_fromsockaddr(&netaddr, &client->peeraddr);
3364
3365 if (client->sctx->blackholeacl != NULL &&
3366 (dns_acl_match(&netaddr, NULL, client->sctx->blackholeacl,
3367 env, &match, NULL) == ISC_R_SUCCESS) &&
3368 match > 0)
3369 {
3370 ns_client_log(client, DNS_LOGCATEGORY_SECURITY,
3371 NS_LOGMODULE_CLIENT, ISC_LOG_DEBUG(10),
3372 "blackholed connection attempt");
3373 client->newstate = NS_CLIENTSTATE_READY;
3374 (void)exit_check(client);
3375 goto freeevent;
3376 }
3377
3378 INSIST(client->tcpmsg_valid == false);
3379 dns_tcpmsg_init(client->mctx, client->tcpsocket,
3380 &client->tcpmsg);
3381 client->tcpmsg_valid = true;
3382
3383 /*
3384 * Let a new client take our place immediately, before
3385 * we wait for a request packet. If we don't,
3386 * telnetting to port 53 (once per CPU) will
3387 * deny service to legitimate TCP clients.
3388 */
3389 result = ns_client_replace(client);
3390 if (result == ISC_R_SUCCESS &&
3391 (client->sctx->keepresporder == NULL ||
3392 !dns_acl_allowed(&netaddr, NULL,
3393 client->sctx->keepresporder, env)))
3394 {
3395 client->tcpconn->pipelined = true;
3396 }
3397
3398 client_read(client, true);
3399 }
3400
3401 freeevent:
3402 isc_event_free(&event);
3403}
3404
3405static void
3406client_accept(ns_client_t *client) {
3407 isc_result_t result;
3408
3409 CTRACE("accept");
3410
3411 /*
3412 * Set up a new TCP connection. This means try to attach to the
3413 * TCP client quota (tcp-clients), but fail if we're over quota.
3414 */
3415 result = tcpconn_init(client, false);
3416 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS) {
3417 bool exit;
3418
3419 ns_client_log(client, NS_LOGCATEGORY_CLIENT,
3420 NS_LOGMODULE_CLIENT, ISC_LOG_WARNING,
3421 "TCP client quota reached: %s",
3422 isc_result_totext(result));
3423
3424 /*
3425 * We have exceeded the system-wide TCP client quota. But,
3426 * we can't just block this accept in all cases, because if
3427 * we did, a heavy TCP load on other interfaces might cause
3428 * this interface to be starved, with no clients able to
3429 * accept new connections.
3430 *
3431 * So, we check here to see if any other clients are
3432 * already servicing TCP queries on this interface (whether
3433 * accepting, reading, or processing). If we find that at
3434 * least one client other than this one is active, then
3435 * it's okay *not* to call accept - we can let this
3436 * client go inactive and another will take over when it's
3437 * done.
3438 *
3439 * If there aren't enough active clients on the interface,
3440 * then we can be a little bit flexible about the quota.
3441 * We'll allow *one* extra client through to ensure we're
3442 * listening on every interface; we do this by setting the
3443 * 'force' option to tcpconn_init().
3444 *
3445 * (Note: In practice this means that the real TCP client
3446 * quota is tcp-clients plus the number of listening
3447 * interfaces plus 1.)
3448 */
3449 exit = (atomic_load(&client->interface->ntcpactive) >
3450 (client->tcpactive ? 1U : 0U));
3451 if (exit) {
3452 client->newstate = NS_CLIENTSTATE_INACTIVE;
3453 (void)exit_check(client);
3454 return;
3455 }
3456
3457 result = tcpconn_init(client, true);
3458 RUNTIME_CHECK(result == ISC_R_SUCCESS);
3459 }
3460
3461 /*
3462 * If this client was set up using get_client() or get_worker(),
3463 * then TCP is already marked active. However, if it was restarted
3464 * from exit_check(), it might not be, so we take care of it now.
3465 */
3466 mark_tcp_active(client, true);
3467
3468 result = isc_socket_accept(client->tcplistener, client->task,
3469 client_newconn, client);
3470 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS) {
3471 /*
3472 * XXXRTH What should we do? We're trying to accept but
3473 * it didn't work. If we just give up, then TCP
3474 * service may eventually stop.
3475 *
3476 * For now, we just go idle.
3477 */
3478 UNEXPECTED_ERROR(__FILE__, __LINE__,
3479 "isc_socket_accept() failed: %s",
3480 isc_result_totext(result));
3481
3482 tcpconn_detach(client);
3483 mark_tcp_active(client, false);
3484 return;
3485 }
3486
3487 /*
3488 * The client's 'naccepts' counter indicates that this client has
3489 * called accept() and is waiting for a new connection. It should
3490 * never exceed 1.
3491 */
3492 INSIST(client->naccepts == 0);
3493 client->naccepts++;
3494
3495 /*
3496 * The interface's 'ntcpaccepting' counter is incremented when
3497 * any client calls accept(), and decremented in client_newconn()
3498 * once the connection is established.
3499 *
3500 * When the client object is shutting down after handling a TCP
3501 * request (see exit_check()), if this value is at least one, that
3502 * means another client has called accept() and is waiting to
3503 * establish the next connection. That means the client may be
3504 * be free to become inactive; otherwise it may need to start
3505 * listening for connections itself to prevent the interface
3506 * going dead.
3507 */
3508 atomic_fetch_add(&client->interface->ntcpaccepting, 1);
3509}
3510
3511static void
3512client_udprecv(ns_client_t *client) {
3513 isc_result_t result;
3514 isc_region_t r;
3515
3516 CTRACE("udprecv");
3517
3518 r.base = client->recvbuf;
3519 r.length = RECV_BUFFER_SIZE;
3520 result = isc_socket_recv2(client->udpsocket, &r, 1,
3521 client->task, client->recvevent, 0);
3522 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS) {
3523 UNEXPECTED_ERROR(__FILE__, __LINE__,
3524 "isc_socket_recv2() failed: %s",
3525 isc_result_totext(result));
3526 /*
3527 * This cannot happen in the current implementation, since
3528 * isc_socket_recv2() cannot fail if flags == 0.
3529 *
3530 * If this does fail, we just go idle.
3531 */
3532 return;
3533 }
3534 INSIST(client->nrecvs == 0);
3535 client->nrecvs++;
3536}
3537
3538void
3539ns_client_attach(ns_client_t *source, ns_client_t **targetp) {
3540 REQUIRE(NS_CLIENT_VALID(source));
3541 REQUIRE(targetp != NULL && *targetp == NULL);
3542
3543 source->references++;
3544 ns_client_log(source, NS_LOGCATEGORY_CLIENT,
3545 NS_LOGMODULE_CLIENT, ISC_LOG_DEBUG(10),
3546 "ns_client_attach: ref = %d", source->references);
3547 *targetp = source;
3548}
3549
3550void
3551ns_client_detach(ns_client_t **clientp) {
3552 ns_client_t *client = *clientp;
3553
3554 client->references--;
3555 INSIST(client->references >= 0);
3556 *clientp = NULL;
3557 ns_client_log(client, NS_LOGCATEGORY_CLIENT,
3558 NS_LOGMODULE_CLIENT, ISC_LOG_DEBUG(10),
3559 "ns_client_detach: ref = %d", client->references);
3560 (void)exit_check(client);
3561}
3562
3563bool
3564ns_client_shuttingdown(ns_client_t *client) {
3565 return (client->newstate == NS_CLIENTSTATE_FREED);
3566}
3567
3568isc_result_t
3569ns_client_replace(ns_client_t *client) {
3570 isc_result_t result;
3571 bool tcp;
3572
3573 CTRACE("replace");
3574
3575 REQUIRE(client != NULL);
3576 REQUIRE(client->manager != NULL);
3577
3578 tcp = TCP_CLIENT(client);
3579 if (tcp && client->tcpconn != NULL && client->tcpconn->pipelined) {
3580 result = get_worker(client->manager, client->interface,
3581 client->tcpsocket, client);
3582 } else {
3583 result = get_client(client->manager, client->interface,
3584 client->dispatch, tcp);
3585
3586 }
3587 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS) {
3588 return (result);
3589 }
3590
3591 /*
3592 * The responsibility for listening for new requests is hereby
3593 * transferred to the new client. Therefore, the old client
3594 * should refrain from listening for any more requests.
3595 */
3596 client->mortal = true;
3597
3598 return (ISC_R_SUCCESS);
3599}
3600
3601/***
3602 *** Client Manager
3603 ***/
3604
3605static void
3606clientmgr_destroy(ns_clientmgr_t *manager) {
3607#if NMCTXS > 0
3608 int i;
3609#endif
3610
3611 REQUIRE(ISC_LIST_EMPTY(manager->clients));
3612
3613 MTRACE("clientmgr_destroy");
3614
3615#if NMCTXS > 0
3616 for (i = 0; i < NMCTXS; i++) {
3617 if (manager->mctxpool[i] != NULL)
3618 isc_mem_detach(&manager->mctxpool[i]);
3619 }
3620#endif
3621
3622 ISC_QUEUE_DESTROY(manager->inactive);
3623
3624 isc_mutex_destroy(&manager->lock);
3625 isc_mutex_destroy(&manager->listlock);
3626 isc_mutex_destroy(&manager->reclock);
3627
3628 if (manager->excl != NULL)
3629 isc_task_detach(&manager->excl);
3630
3631 ns_server_detach(&manager->sctx);
3632
3633 manager->magic = 0;
3634 isc_mem_put(manager->mctx, manager, sizeof(*manager));
3635}
3636
3637isc_result_t
3638ns_clientmgr_create(isc_mem_t *mctx, ns_server_t *sctx, isc_taskmgr_t *taskmgr,
3639 isc_timermgr_t *timermgr, ns_clientmgr_t **managerp)
3640{
3641 ns_clientmgr_t *manager;
3642 isc_result_t result;
3643#if NMCTXS > 0
3644 int i;
3645#endif
3646
3647 manager = isc_mem_get(mctx, sizeof(*manager));
3648 if (manager == NULL)
3649 return (ISC_R_NOMEMORY);
3650
3651 isc_mutex_init(&manager->lock);
3652 isc_mutex_init(&manager->listlock);
3653 isc_mutex_init(&manager->reclock);
3654
3655 manager->excl = NULL;
3656 result = isc_taskmgr_excltask(taskmgr, &manager->excl);
3657 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS) {
3658 goto cleanup_reclock;
3659 }
3660
3661 manager->mctx = mctx;
3662 manager->taskmgr = taskmgr;
3663 manager->timermgr = timermgr;
3664 manager->exiting = false;
3665
3666 manager->sctx = NULL;
3667 ns_server_attach(sctx, &manager->sctx);
3668
3669 ISC_LIST_INIT(manager->clients);
3670 ISC_LIST_INIT(manager->recursing);
3671 ISC_QUEUE_INIT(manager->inactive, ilink);
3672#if NMCTXS > 0
3673 manager->nextmctx = 0;
3674 for (i = 0; i < NMCTXS; i++)
3675 manager->mctxpool[i] = NULL; /* will be created on-demand */
3676#endif
3677 manager->magic = MANAGER_MAGIC;
3678
3679 MTRACE("create");
3680
3681 *managerp = manager;
3682
3683 return (ISC_R_SUCCESS);
3684
3685 cleanup_reclock:
3686 isc_mutex_destroy(&manager->reclock);
3687 isc_mutex_destroy(&manager->listlock);
3688 isc_mutex_destroy(&manager->lock);
3689
3690 isc_mem_put(manager->mctx, manager, sizeof(*manager));
3691
3692 return (result);
3693}
3694
3695void
3696ns_clientmgr_destroy(ns_clientmgr_t **managerp) {
3697 isc_result_t result;
3698 ns_clientmgr_t *manager;
3699 ns_client_t *client;
3700 bool need_destroy = false, unlock = false;
3701
3702 REQUIRE(managerp != NULL);
3703 manager = *managerp;
3704 REQUIRE(VALID_MANAGER(manager));
3705
3706 MTRACE("destroy");
3707
3708 /*
3709 * Check for success because we may already be task-exclusive
3710 * at this point. Only if we succeed at obtaining an exclusive
3711 * lock now will we need to relinquish it later.
3712 */
3713 result = isc_task_beginexclusive(manager->excl);
3714 if (result == ISC_R_SUCCESS)
3715 unlock = true;
3716
3717 manager->exiting = true;
3718
3719 for (client = ISC_LIST_HEAD(manager->clients);
3720 client != NULL;
3721 client = ISC_LIST_NEXT(client, link))
3722 isc_task_shutdown(client->task);
3723
3724 if (ISC_LIST_EMPTY(manager->clients))
3725 need_destroy = true;
3726
3727 if (unlock)
3728 isc_task_endexclusive(manager->excl);
3729
3730 if (need_destroy)
3731 clientmgr_destroy(manager);
3732
3733 *managerp = NULL;
3734}
3735
3736static isc_result_t
3737get_client(ns_clientmgr_t *manager, ns_interface_t *ifp,
3738 dns_dispatch_t *disp, bool tcp)
3739{
3740 isc_result_t result = ISC_R_SUCCESS;
3741 isc_event_t *ev;
3742 ns_client_t *client;
3743 MTRACE("get client");
3744
3745 REQUIRE(manager != NULL);
3746
3747 if (manager->exiting)
3748 return (ISC_R_SHUTTINGDOWN);
3749
3750 /*
3751 * Allocate a client. First try to get a recycled one;
3752 * if that fails, make a new one.
3753 */
3754 client = NULL;
3755 if ((manager->sctx->options & NS_SERVER_CLIENTTEST) == 0)
3756 ISC_QUEUE_POP(manager->inactive, ilink, client);
3757
3758 if (client != NULL)
3759 MTRACE("recycle");
3760 else {
3761 MTRACE("create new");
3762
3763 LOCK(&manager->lock);
3764 result = client_create(manager, &client);
3765 UNLOCK(&manager->lock);
3766 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS)
3767 return (result);
3768
3769 LOCK(&manager->listlock);
3770 ISC_LIST_APPEND(manager->clients, client, link);
3771 UNLOCK(&manager->listlock);
3772 }
3773
3774 client->manager = manager;
3775 ns_interface_attach(ifp, &client->interface);
3776 client->state = NS_CLIENTSTATE_READY;
3777 client->sctx = manager->sctx;
3778 INSIST(client->recursionquota == NULL);
3779
3780 client->dscp = ifp->dscp;
3781
3782 if (tcp) {
3783 mark_tcp_active(client, true);
3784
3785 client->attributes |= NS_CLIENTATTR_TCP;
3786 isc_socket_attach(ifp->tcpsocket,
3787 &client->tcplistener);
3788
3789 } else {
3790 isc_socket_t *sock;
3791
3792 dns_dispatch_attach(disp, &client->dispatch);
3793 sock = dns_dispatch_getsocket(client->dispatch);
3794 isc_socket_attach(sock, &client->udpsocket);
3795 }
3796
3797 INSIST(client->nctls == 0);
3798 client->nctls++;
3799 ev = &client->ctlevent;
3800 isc_task_send(client->task, &ev);
3801
3802 return (ISC_R_SUCCESS);
3803}
3804
3805static isc_result_t
3806get_worker(ns_clientmgr_t *manager, ns_interface_t *ifp, isc_socket_t *sock,
3807 ns_client_t *oldclient)
3808{
3809 isc_result_t result = ISC_R_SUCCESS;
3810 isc_event_t *ev;
3811 ns_client_t *client;
3812 MTRACE("get worker");
3813
3814 REQUIRE(manager != NULL);
3815 REQUIRE(oldclient != NULL);
3816
3817 if (manager->exiting)
3818 return (ISC_R_SHUTTINGDOWN);
3819
3820 /*
3821 * Allocate a client. First try to get a recycled one;
3822 * if that fails, make a new one.
3823 */
3824 client = NULL;
3825 if ((manager->sctx->options & NS_SERVER_CLIENTTEST) == 0)
3826 ISC_QUEUE_POP(manager->inactive, ilink, client);
3827
3828 if (client != NULL)
3829 MTRACE("recycle");
3830 else {
3831 MTRACE("create new");
3832
3833 LOCK(&manager->lock);
3834 result = client_create(manager, &client);
3835 UNLOCK(&manager->lock);
3836 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS)
3837 return (result);
3838
3839 LOCK(&manager->listlock);
3840 ISC_LIST_APPEND(manager->clients, client, link);
3841 UNLOCK(&manager->listlock);
3842 }
3843
3844 client->manager = manager;
3845 ns_interface_attach(ifp, &client->interface);
3846 client->newstate = client->state = NS_CLIENTSTATE_WORKING;
3847 INSIST(client->recursionquota == NULL);
3848 client->sctx = manager->sctx;
3849
3850 client->dscp = ifp->dscp;
3851
3852 client->attributes |= NS_CLIENTATTR_TCP;
3853 client->mortal = true;
3854 client->sendcb = NULL;
3855
3856 tcpconn_attach(oldclient, client);
3857 mark_tcp_active(client, true);
3858
3859 isc_socket_attach(ifp->tcpsocket, &client->tcplistener);
3860 isc_socket_attach(sock, &client->tcpsocket);
3861 isc_socket_setname(client->tcpsocket, "worker-tcp", NULL);
3862 (void)isc_socket_getpeername(client->tcpsocket, &client->peeraddr);
3863 client->peeraddr_valid = true;
3864
3865 INSIST(client->tcpmsg_valid == false);
3866 dns_tcpmsg_init(client->mctx, client->tcpsocket, &client->tcpmsg);
3867 client->tcpmsg_valid = true;
3868
3869 INSIST(client->nctls == 0);
3870 client->nctls++;
3871 ev = &client->ctlevent;
3872 isc_task_send(client->task, &ev);
3873
3874 return (ISC_R_SUCCESS);
3875}
3876
3877isc_result_t
3878ns__clientmgr_getclient(ns_clientmgr_t *manager, ns_interface_t *ifp,
3879 bool tcp, ns_client_t **clientp)
3880{
3881 isc_result_t result = ISC_R_SUCCESS;
3882 ns_client_t *client;
3883 MTRACE("getclient");
3884
3885 REQUIRE(VALID_MANAGER(manager));
3886 REQUIRE(clientp != NULL && *clientp == NULL);
3887
3888 if (manager->exiting)
3889 return (ISC_R_SHUTTINGDOWN);
3890
3891 client = NULL;
3892 ISC_QUEUE_POP(manager->inactive, ilink, client);
3893 if (client != NULL)
3894 MTRACE("getclient (recycle)");
3895 else {
3896 MTRACE("getclient (create)");
3897
3898 LOCK(&manager->lock);
3899 result = client_create(manager, &client);
3900 UNLOCK(&manager->lock);
3901 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS)
3902 return (result);
3903
3904 LOCK(&manager->listlock);
3905 ISC_LIST_APPEND(manager->clients, client, link);
3906 UNLOCK(&manager->listlock);
3907 }
3908
3909 client->manager = manager;
3910 ns_interface_attach(ifp, &client->interface);
3911 client->state = NS_CLIENTSTATE_READY;
3912 INSIST(client->recursionquota == NULL);
3913
3914 client->dscp = ifp->dscp;
3915 client->references++;
3916
3917 if (tcp) {
3918 client->attributes |= NS_CLIENTATTR_TCP;
3919 }
3920
3921 *clientp = client;
3922
3923 return (ISC_R_SUCCESS);
3924}
3925
3926isc_result_t
3927ns_clientmgr_createclients(ns_clientmgr_t *manager, unsigned int n,
3928 ns_interface_t *ifp, bool tcp)
3929{
3930 isc_result_t result = ISC_R_SUCCESS;
3931 unsigned int disp;
3932
3933 REQUIRE(VALID_MANAGER(manager));
3934 REQUIRE(n > 0);
3935
3936 MTRACE("createclients");
3937
3938 for (disp = 0; disp < n; disp++) {
3939 result = get_client(manager, ifp, ifp->udpdispatch[disp], tcp);
3940 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS)
3941 break;
3942 }
3943
3944 return (result);
3945}

3947isc_sockaddr_t *
3948ns_client_getsockaddr(ns_client_t *client) {
3949 return (&client->peeraddr);
3950}

3956
3957isc_result_t
3958ns_client_checkaclsilent(ns_client_t *client, isc_netaddr_t *netaddr,
3959 dns_acl_t *acl, bool default_allow)
3960{
3961 isc_result_t result;
3962 dns_aclenv_t *env = ns_interfacemgr_getaclenv(client->interface->mgr);
3963 isc_netaddr_t tmpnetaddr;
3964 int match;
3965
3966 if (acl == NULL) {
3967 if (default_allow)
3968 goto allow;
3969 else
3970 goto deny;
3971 }
3972
3973 if (netaddr == NULL) {
3974 isc_netaddr_fromsockaddr(&tmpnetaddr, &client->peeraddr);
3975 netaddr = &tmpnetaddr;
3976 }
3977
3978 result = dns_acl_match(netaddr, client->signer, acl,
3979 env, &match, NULL);
3980 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS)
3981 goto deny; /* Internal error, already logged. */
3982
3983 if (match > 0)
3984 goto allow;
3985 goto deny; /* Negative match or no match. */
3986
3987 allow:
3988 return (ISC_R_SUCCESS);
3989
3990 deny:
3991 return (DNS_R_REFUSED);
3992}
3993
3994isc_result_t
3995ns_client_checkacl(ns_client_t *client, isc_sockaddr_t *sockaddr,
3996 const char *opname, dns_acl_t *acl,
3997 bool default_allow, int log_level)
3998{
3999 isc_result_t result;
4000 isc_netaddr_t netaddr;
4001
4002 if (sockaddr != NULL)
4003 isc_netaddr_fromsockaddr(&netaddr, sockaddr);
4004
4005 result = ns_client_checkaclsilent(client, sockaddr ? &netaddr : NULL,
4006 acl, default_allow);
4007
4008 if (result == ISC_R_SUCCESS)
4009 ns_client_log(client, DNS_LOGCATEGORY_SECURITY,
4010 NS_LOGMODULE_CLIENT, ISC_LOG_DEBUG(3),
4011 "%s approved", opname);
4012 else
4013 ns_client_log(client, DNS_LOGCATEGORY_SECURITY,
4014 NS_LOGMODULE_CLIENT,
4015 log_level, "%s denied", opname);
4016 return (result);
4017}
4018
4019static void
4020ns_client_name(ns_client_t *client, char *peerbuf, size_t len) {
4021 if (client->peeraddr_valid)
4022 isc_sockaddr_format(&client->peeraddr, peerbuf,
4023 (unsigned int)len);
4024 else
4025 snprintf(peerbuf, len, "@%p", client);
4026}
4027
4028void
4029ns_client_logv(ns_client_t *client, isc_logcategory_t *category,
4030 isc_logmodule_t *module, int level, const char *fmt, va_list ap)
4031{
4032 char msgbuf[4096];
4033 char signerbuf[DNS_NAME_FORMATSIZE], qnamebuf[DNS_NAME_FORMATSIZE];
4034 char peerbuf[ISC_SOCKADDR_FORMATSIZE];
4035 const char *viewname = "";
4036 const char *sep1 = "", *sep2 = "", *sep3 = "", *sep4 = "";
4037 const char *signer = "", *qname = "";
4038 dns_name_t *q = NULL;
4039
4040 vsnprintf(msgbuf, sizeof(msgbuf), fmt, ap);
4041
4042 if (client->signer != NULL) {
4043 dns_name_format(client->signer, signerbuf, sizeof(signerbuf));
4044 sep1 = "/key ";
4045 signer = signerbuf;
4046 }
4047
4048 q = client->query.origqname != NULL
4049 ? client->query.origqname : client->query.qname;
4050 if (q != NULL) {
4051 dns_name_format(q, qnamebuf, sizeof(qnamebuf));
4052 sep2 = " (";
4053 sep3 = ")";
4054 qname = qnamebuf;
4055 }
4056
4057 if (client->view != NULL && strcmp(client->view->name, "_bind") != 0 &&
4058 strcmp(client->view->name, "_default") != 0) {
4059 sep4 = ": view ";
4060 viewname = client->view->name;
4061 }
4062
4063 if (client->peeraddr_valid) {
4064 isc_sockaddr_format(&client->peeraddr,
4065 peerbuf, sizeof(peerbuf));
4066 } else {
4067 snprintf(peerbuf, sizeof(peerbuf), "(no-peer)");
4068 }
4069
4070 isc_log_write(ns_lctx, category, module, level,
4071 "client @%p %s%s%s%s%s%s%s%s: %s",
4072 client, peerbuf, sep1, signer, sep2, qname, sep3,
4073 sep4, viewname, msgbuf);
4074}
4075
4076void
4077ns_client_log(ns_client_t *client, isc_logcategory_t *category,
4078 isc_logmodule_t *module, int level, const char *fmt, ...)
4079{
4080 va_list ap;
4081
4082 if (! isc_log_wouldlog(ns_lctx, level))
4083 return;
4084
4085 va_start(ap, fmt);
4086 ns_client_logv(client, category, module, level, fmt, ap);
4087 va_end(ap);
4088}

4090void
4091ns_client_aclmsg(const char *msg, const dns_name_t *name, dns_rdatatype_t type,
4092 dns_rdataclass_t rdclass, char *buf, size_t len)
4093{
4094 char namebuf[DNS_NAME_FORMATSIZE];
4095 char typebuf[DNS_RDATATYPE_FORMATSIZE];
4096 char classbuf[DNS_RDATACLASS_FORMATSIZE];
4097
4098 dns_name_format(name, namebuf, sizeof(namebuf));
4099 dns_rdatatype_format(type, typebuf, sizeof(typebuf));
4100 dns_rdataclass_format(rdclass, classbuf, sizeof(classbuf));
4101 (void)snprintf(buf, len, "%s '%s/%s/%s'", msg, namebuf, typebuf,
4102 classbuf);
4103}
4104
4105static void
4106ns_client_dumpmessage(ns_client_t *client, const char *reason) {
4107 isc_buffer_t buffer;
4108 char *buf = NULL;
4109 int len = 1024;
4110 isc_result_t result;
4111
4112 if (!isc_log_wouldlog(ns_lctx, ISC_LOG_DEBUG(1)))
4113 return;
4114
4115 /*
4116 * Note that these are multiline debug messages. We want a newline
4117 * to appear in the log after each message.
4118 */
4119
4120 do {
4121 buf = isc_mem_get(client->mctx, len);
4122 if (buf == NULL)
4123 break;
4124 isc_buffer_init(&buffer, buf, len);
4125 result = dns_message_totext(client->message,
4126 &dns_master_style_debug,
4127 0, &buffer);
4128 if (result == ISC_R_NOSPACE) {
4129 isc_mem_put(client->mctx, buf, len);
4130 len += 1024;
4131 } else if (result == ISC_R_SUCCESS)
4132 ns_client_log(client, NS_LOGCATEGORY_CLIENT,
4133 NS_LOGMODULE_CLIENT, ISC_LOG_DEBUG(1),
4134 "%s\n%.*s", reason,
4135 (int)isc_buffer_usedlength(&buffer),
4136 buf);
4137 } while (result == ISC_R_NOSPACE);
4138
4139 if (buf != NULL)
4140 isc_mem_put(client->mctx, buf, len);
4141}
4142
4143void
4144ns_client_dumprecursing(FILE *f, ns_clientmgr_t *manager) {
4145 ns_client_t *client;
4146 char namebuf[DNS_NAME_FORMATSIZE];
4147 char original[DNS_NAME_FORMATSIZE];
4148 char peerbuf[ISC_SOCKADDR_FORMATSIZE];
4149 char typebuf[DNS_RDATATYPE_FORMATSIZE];
4150 char classbuf[DNS_RDATACLASS_FORMATSIZE];
4151 const char *name;
4152 const char *sep;
4153 const char *origfor;
4154 dns_rdataset_t *rdataset;
4155
4156 REQUIRE(VALID_MANAGER(manager));
4157
4158 LOCK(&manager->reclock);
4159 client = ISC_LIST_HEAD(manager->recursing);
4160 while (client != NULL) {
4161 INSIST(client->state == NS_CLIENTSTATE_RECURSING);
4162
4163 ns_client_name(client, peerbuf, sizeof(peerbuf));
4164 if (client->view != NULL &&
4165 strcmp(client->view->name, "_bind") != 0 &&
4166 strcmp(client->view->name, "_default") != 0) {
4167 name = client->view->name;
4168 sep = ": view ";
4169 } else {
4170 name = "";
4171 sep = "";
4172 }
4173
4174 LOCK(&client->query.fetchlock);
4175 INSIST(client->query.qname != NULL);
4176 dns_name_format(client->query.qname, namebuf, sizeof(namebuf));
4177 if (client->query.qname != client->query.origqname &&
4178 client->query.origqname != NULL) {
4179 origfor = " for ";
4180 dns_name_format(client->query.origqname, original,
4181 sizeof(original));
4182 } else {
4183 origfor = "";
4184 original[0] = '\0';
4185 }
4186 rdataset = ISC_LIST_HEAD(client->query.qname->list);
4187 if (rdataset == NULL && client->query.origqname != NULL)
4188 rdataset = ISC_LIST_HEAD(client->query.origqname->list);
4189 if (rdataset != NULL) {
4190 dns_rdatatype_format(rdataset->type, typebuf,
4191 sizeof(typebuf));
4192 dns_rdataclass_format(rdataset->rdclass, classbuf,
4193 sizeof(classbuf));
4194 } else {
4195 strlcpy(typebuf, "-", sizeof(typebuf));
4196 strlcpy(classbuf, "-", sizeof(classbuf));
4197 }
4198 UNLOCK(&client->query.fetchlock);
4199 fprintf(f, "; client %s%s%s: id %u '%s/%s/%s'%s%s "
4200 "requesttime %u\n", peerbuf, sep, name,
4201 client->message->id, namebuf, typebuf, classbuf,
4202 origfor, original,
4203 isc_time_seconds(&client->requesttime));
4204 client = ISC_LIST_NEXT(client, rlink);
4205 }
4206 UNLOCK(&manager->reclock);
4207}
4208
4209void
4210ns_client_qnamereplace(ns_client_t *client, dns_name_t *name) {
4211 LOCK(&client->query.fetchlock);
4212 if (client->query.restarts > 0) {
4213 /*
4214 * client->query.qname was dynamically allocated.
4215 */
4216 dns_message_puttempname(client->message,
4217 &client->query.qname);
4218 }
4219 client->query.qname = name;
4220 client->query.attributes &= ~NS_QUERYATTR_REDIRECT;
4221 UNLOCK(&client->query.fetchlock);
4222}

4230
4231 *addrp = &client->peeraddr;

4236ns_client_newrdataset(ns_client_t *client) {
4237 dns_rdataset_t *rdataset;

4239
4240 REQUIRE(NS_CLIENT_VALID(client));
4241
4242 rdataset = NULL;
4243 result = dns_message_gettemprdataset(client->message, &rdataset);
4244 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS) {
4245 return (NULL);
4246 }

4251void
4252ns_client_putrdataset(ns_client_t *client, dns_rdataset_t **rdatasetp) {
4253 dns_rdataset_t *rdataset;
4254
4255 REQUIRE(NS_CLIENT_VALID(client));
4256 REQUIRE(rdatasetp != NULL);
4257
4258 rdataset = *rdatasetp;
4259
4260 if (rdataset != NULL) {
4261 if (dns_rdataset_isassociated(rdataset)) {
4262 dns_rdataset_disassociate(rdataset);
4263 }
4264 dns_message_puttemprdataset(client->message, rdatasetp);
4265 }
4266}
4267
4268isc_result_t
4269ns_client_newnamebuf(ns_client_t *client) {
4270 isc_buffer_t *dbuf;
4271 isc_result_t result;
4272
4273 CTRACE("ns_client_newnamebuf");
4274
4275 dbuf = NULL;
4276 result = isc_buffer_allocate(client->mctx, &dbuf, 1024);
4277 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS) {
4278 CTRACE("ns_client_newnamebuf: "
4279 "isc_buffer_allocate failed: done");
4280 return (result);
4281 }
4282 ISC_LIST_APPEND(client->query.namebufs, dbuf, link);
4283
4284 CTRACE("ns_client_newnamebuf: done");
4285 return (ISC_R_SUCCESS);
4286}
4287
4288dns_name_t *
4289ns_client_newname(ns_client_t *client, isc_buffer_t *dbuf, isc_buffer_t *nbuf) {
4290 dns_name_t *name;
4291 isc_region_t r;
4292 isc_result_t result;
4293
4294 REQUIRE((client->query.attributes & NS_QUERYATTR_NAMEBUFUSED) == 0);
4295
4296 CTRACE("ns_client_newname");
4297
4298 name = NULL;
4299 result = dns_message_gettempname(client->message, &name);
4300 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS) {
4301 CTRACE("ns_client_newname: "
4302 "dns_message_gettempname failed: done");
4303 return (NULL);
4304 }
4305 isc_buffer_availableregion(dbuf, &r);
4306 isc_buffer_init(nbuf, r.base, r.length);
4307 dns_name_init(name, NULL);
4308 dns_name_setbuffer(name, nbuf);
4309 client->query.attributes |= NS_QUERYATTR_NAMEBUFUSED;
4310
4311 CTRACE("ns_client_newname: done");
4312 return (name);
4313}
4314
4315isc_buffer_t *
4316ns_client_getnamebuf(ns_client_t *client) {
4317 isc_buffer_t *dbuf;
4318 isc_result_t result;
4319 isc_region_t r;
4320
4321 CTRACE("ns_client_getnamebuf");
4322
4323 /*%
4324 * Return a name buffer with space for a maximal name, allocating
4325 * a new one if necessary.
4326 */
4327 if (ISC_LIST_EMPTY(client->query.namebufs)) {
4328 result = ns_client_newnamebuf(client);
4329 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS) {
4330 CTRACE("ns_client_getnamebuf: "
4331 "ns_client_newnamebuf failed: done");
4332 return (NULL);
4333 }
4334 }
4335
4336 dbuf = ISC_LIST_TAIL(client->query.namebufs);
4337 INSIST(dbuf != NULL);
4338 isc_buffer_availableregion(dbuf, &r);
4339 if (r.length < DNS_NAME_MAXWIRE) {
4340 result = ns_client_newnamebuf(client);
4341 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS) {
4342 CTRACE("ns_client_getnamebuf: "
4343 "ns_client_newnamebuf failed: done");
4344 return (NULL);
4345
4346 }
4347 dbuf = ISC_LIST_TAIL(client->query.namebufs);
4348 isc_buffer_availableregion(dbuf, &r);
4349 INSIST(r.length >= 255);
4350 }
4351 CTRACE("ns_client_getnamebuf: done");
4352 return (dbuf);
4353}
4354
4355void
4356ns_client_keepname(ns_client_t *client, dns_name_t *name, isc_buffer_t *dbuf) {
4357 isc_region_t r;
4358
4359 CTRACE("ns_client_keepname");
4360
4361 /*%
4362 * 'name' is using space in 'dbuf', but 'dbuf' has not yet been
4363 * adjusted to take account of that. We do the adjustment.
4364 */
4365 REQUIRE((client->query.attributes & NS_QUERYATTR_NAMEBUFUSED) != 0);
4366
4367 dns_name_toregion(name, &r);
4368 isc_buffer_add(dbuf, r.length);
4369 dns_name_setbuffer(name, NULL);
4370 client->query.attributes &= ~NS_QUERYATTR_NAMEBUFUSED;
4371}
4372
4373void
4374ns_client_releasename(ns_client_t *client, dns_name_t **namep) {
4375 dns_name_t *name = *namep;
4376
4377 /*%
4378 * 'name' is no longer needed. Return it to our pool of temporary
4379 * names. If it is using a name buffer, relinquish its exclusive
4380 * rights on the buffer.
4381 */
4382
4383 CTRACE("ns_client_releasename");
4384 if (dns_name_hasbuffer(name)) {
4385 INSIST((client->query.attributes & NS_QUERYATTR_NAMEBUFUSED)
4386 != 0);
4387 client->query.attributes &= ~NS_QUERYATTR_NAMEBUFUSED;
4388 }
4389 dns_message_puttempname(client->message, namep);
4390 CTRACE("ns_client_releasename: done");
4391}
4392
4393isc_result_t
4394ns_client_newdbversion(ns_client_t *client, unsigned int n) {
4395 unsigned int i;
4396 ns_dbversion_t *dbversion;
4397
4398 for (i = 0; i < n; i++) {
4399 dbversion = isc_mem_get(client->mctx, sizeof(*dbversion));
4400 if (dbversion != NULL) {
4401 dbversion->db = NULL;
4402 dbversion->version = NULL;
4403 ISC_LIST_INITANDAPPEND(client->query.freeversions,
4404 dbversion, link);
4405 } else {
4406 /*
4407 * We only return ISC_R_NOMEMORY if we couldn't
4408 * allocate anything.
4409 */
4410 if (i == 0) {
4411 return (ISC_R_NOMEMORY);
4412 } else {
4413 return (ISC_R_SUCCESS);
4414 }
4415 }
4416 }
4417
4418 return (ISC_R_SUCCESS);
4419}
4420
4421static inline ns_dbversion_t *
4422client_getdbversion(ns_client_t *client) {
4423 isc_result_t result;
4424 ns_dbversion_t *dbversion;
4425
4426 if (ISC_LIST_EMPTY(client->query.freeversions)) {
4427 result = ns_client_newdbversion(client, 1);
4428 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS) {
4429 return (NULL);
4430 }
4431 }
4432 dbversion = ISC_LIST_HEAD(client->query.freeversions);
4433 INSIST(dbversion != NULL);
4434 ISC_LIST_UNLINK(client->query.freeversions, dbversion, link);
4435
4436 return (dbversion);
4437}
4438
4439ns_dbversion_t *
4440ns_client_findversion(ns_client_t *client, dns_db_t *db) {
4441 ns_dbversion_t *dbversion;
4442
4443 for (dbversion = ISC_LIST_HEAD(client->query.activeversions);
4444 dbversion != NULL;
4445 dbversion = ISC_LIST_NEXT(dbversion, link))
4446 {
4447 if (dbversion->db == db) {
4448 break;
4449 }
4450 }
4451
4452 if (dbversion == NULL) {
4453 /*
4454 * This is a new zone for this query. Add it to
4455 * the active list.
4456 */
4457 dbversion = client_getdbversion(client);
4458 if (dbversion == NULL) {
4459 return (NULL);
4460 }
4461 dns_db_attach(db, &dbversion->db);
4462 dns_db_currentversion(db, &dbversion->version);
4463 dbversion->acl_checked = false;
4464 dbversion->queryok = false;
4465 ISC_LIST_APPEND(client->query.activeversions,
4466 dbversion, link);
4467 }
4468
4469 return (dbversion);
4470}
